name: Beth Babin
text: The staff are always pretty friendly and the office is amazing. Unfortunately the dentist doesn't seem like he should be working with children. The past two times I have been in,  my son complained of not being numb when they started the procedure and the dentist flat out ignored him.  The first visit (for a pulled tooth) the dentist eventually stopped and gave him another shot, after which he was fine. This 2nd time, we were told we were the ONLY patients in the office, but the dentist seemed inconvenienced to even come in the room,  didn't say 2 words to me and acted in a rush to leave. He started a filling and my son raised his hand and made noises to let him know he could feel it, but the dr kept going and told the nurses "He's fine." Then when my son finally jumped & grabbed his hand, he got aggravated and said to refer us to a pediatric dentist to be sedated. Very rudely made a point to say he wasn't even touching his teeth when he jumped. He didn't even offer to give him another shot or try to comfort him/talk to him about what he was feeling. My son is 11, knows what he can feel & has never had this problem with other dentists. :( I am very disappointed that an office so heavily geared towards children & close to home, has such an impatient & unkind dentist.

name: Fred Peace II
text:
Heads up!
The Optometrist’s operation in the back is one
*gotcha* after another.
They didn’t disclose the price could go up from $189 for the contact lens fitting until after the contact lens fitting started.
*gotcha*
They didn’t disclose that this Optometrist chooses to require a follow up visit for ALL contact lens fittings. I’ve worn contacts for over 30 years...never have I been required to do a follow up...until they have me on the hook for $189...oh, it costs $40 to miss an appointment at a place that accepts walk-ins...so never make an appointment with these people.
*gotcha*
You will have to come back in a week or they will withhold your prescription so basically you will lose $100. They know the follow up visit is not something that all Optometrists do, so the follow-up visit seems worth a mention.
Oh, FYI
They did not disclose that the contact lenses had to be in your eyes for 4 hrs before they will perform the follow up so you will have plenty of time to kill if you’re an honest person.
*gotcha*
then they dated the prescription the day of the initial visit. So, no bonus for coming all the way back for the follow up. That seems to just justify them charging $70 more than their nearest competitor.

The staff in the front where the glasses are made were very friendly and helpful. They did a great job on my $313 glasses. I was really impressed with their utilization of the digital system to measure my pupils and adjust my daughter’s glasses so both of us had a great fit.

I expected to pay a premium for the convenience of having the glasses immediately...but the people at the Optometrists practice really go the extra mile to beat out all the convenience. I wouldn’t recommend coming here unless you had an existing prescription. Otherwise, the Optometrist staff really goes out of their way to not tell you anything...or help you out at all.

name: Patricia Kenny
text: Totally pleased with the exam I received; it was a very thorough eye exam.  My only angst is how they handle insurance payments if something found during the exam is considered "medical" instead of vision-related.  Even with them being a "in-network" provider, I still had to pay out of pocket close to $100 for an office visit.  Also, making the appointment was confusing, as LensCrafters appears to be totally different than the actual optometrist-- they just share space and provide a $15 discount if you purchase glasses from LensCrafters.  And, the eye glasses are extremely overpriced!

name: Derek Watson
text: Scheduled an exam for contacts. Was told on phone if it was a medical visit it would not be covered by insurance, but as I said I went in for a standard eye exam for contacts. They did everything Walmarts Eyecare does except measure your eye. When it was OVER, they told me it turned into a medical exam. At no point during the process did these scam artist inform the patient they were changing the visit to a medical exam. From other reviews it seems this is standard practice for this company. I recommend staying far away from BRADLEY EYE CARE before you are the next victim. Luckily I reported this scam to my insurance company right away and have appealed the charges. I learned to stick with my hometown eye doctor for visits and take my prescriptions to Walmarts to get my glasses. Thank you Bradley Eye Care.

name: Abby Fowler
text:
I went there recently for an eye exam and I have never felt so uncomfortable at an eye doctor in my life. The ladies at the front desk were lovely, but the man who did my prescreening was awful. He was rude right off the bat. I'm generally a nervous person when it comes to doctors and I like to know what's going on, however when I was asking questions about what he was trying to do to me, he got annoyed and kept trying to rush me into doing things. This automatically put me off, and made me feel unsafe. The puffer  test, for Glaucoma always has made me really nervous, but usually I try my best to get through it. However, I felt so unsafe and uncomfortable in the small room with this man that I was not about to do anything I wasn't comfortable doing to begin with. When it came to doing the eye mapping, he kept getting frustrated because he wasn't getting a good picture and ended up pushing my head pretty hard into the equipment. I wish I would've left at this point, but I figured it was probably just all in my head. He asked if he could hold open my eye, but made no attempt to even put on a glove, and at this point I had 0 trust in the guy. When I went into the exam room, the doctor was condescending. I try to tell doctors that I get anxious around them, and it typically helps the appointment go smoother, but she as well rushed me through everything which made me feel really uncomfortable. She then went to put drops in my eye, because I denied the puffer test and became really mad and threw down her paper towels she was holding when I refused. I know it is an important test, but they didn't try to establish any trust, and made me feel really freaked out and uncomfortable. I figured I don't have to go here again, and will take the test with a doctor who I actually trust, and who treats their patients with kindness.

To sum it up I will never be going to this location again, nor will I suggest it to anyone. They made me feel uncomfortable and unsafe.

name: jackson phillips
text: Had an absolutely awesome experience with the staff here. Great customer service and speedy service!

name: Jessica Davis
text:
I should have read the review prior to booking an appointment.  Still I didn't learn from them overcharging me from last year, that was partly due to my not so great insurance coverage.  I've been wearing corrective lenses for decades.  This would be my second visit to this office, I was in need of new glasses and my old prescription expired, so I dropped in on my lunch break.  This was one of few places my insurance covered.  The office assistants were nice.  They tried to upsell my dilation but I told the girl that I wanted to keep everything under my insurance coverage.  Everything went fine until I had to wait 45 minutes for Dr. Davis finish her causal conversation with the patient next door. When she finally appeared, she touched base on the astigmatism in my left eye.  I've had an astigmatism in that eye for years and there has yet to be any issues about it.  She said she wanted to try a specific contact lens for that eye, she would order me free trial and that I'm to come back for a follow-up.  She also suggested that I change my disposable contact lens from daily to weekly.  She asked if I slept in them, I said no because I rub my eyes in my sleep and I have symptomatic reactions with allergies which causes severe protein buildup.  She said she will write a prescription for some allergy drops.  I didn't think I needed them because I haven't had an allergic reaction like that in a while. So I thought I would just not get the prescription.  Finally I am about to check-out and the lady at the desk, Sarah, tells me that my final total is over $100.  I only assumed that my copay would be $40. Sarah said that my eye exam "became a medical visit because the written prescription for the eye drops and the specialized fit for the new contact lens we are ordering."  I was blown away.  I had no room in my budget for that.  I know I signed the form understanding there would be extra costs but they should at least TELL me as they are working what costs are to be incurred.  Sarah saw I was distraught and made and additional comment, "You know, I'm working on getting a coupon for these drops.  I don't know what your co-pay is, but these drops are expensive.  The coupon will make sure you don't pay more than $25. Oh and the follow-up visit is free."  Thanks but no thanks, you obviously know what you were doing and got caught.  I don't plan to fill out the unnecessary prescription.  I don't plan to use this office again.  I'll go back to get the rest of my contact prescription and that's it.  No more.  I've been seeing an ophthalmologists for, years under basic insurance and my copay was not over $20, let alone any surprise charges for a non-invasive visit.  My suggestion is to go elsewhere.  A medical office is supposed to take care of their patients, not rob them blind.

Update 7/18/2014:  I came back for my follow up for my contact fitting.  This time I was seen by Dr. Bradley.  He asked about the contacts that were given to me, I told them that the left lens was difficult to adjust to because it was thicker than the right lens and that with my new job, I'm looking at a computer more so they dry out faster.  He examined my eyes and found out that it wasn't the computer use that was drying out my eyes.  He said the contact lens material was not working with my body chemistry and that my tears were being repelled from the lens and not being absorbed for normal wear.  He then looked closer at my prescription and said that I didn't have a need for these special lens.  I was doing fine before and this was not a solution to my problem.  He referred me to use a different lens, free of charge, and crossed out Dr. Davis' previous notes in red marker.  I'm so glad there was a second opinion in the same office that could help me out.

name: Carla Crane
text: The people were nice, but over priced. Never going back because I got pink eye after my exam there. I don't think they clean their equipment well.

text: I didn't have an appointment and walk in and saw the Dr. The front desk was most helpful and the Dr., went over my exam and showed how my eyes were during over the past three years. See you guys next year!!!!

name: Helena Last
text: The staff physically abused me. They threw books at me and raised their middle fingers towards me. They also over charged me by $50 dollars. Why? They claimed I had eye cancer and told other patients about it and what their opinions were without my permission. The Doctor Connie Davis is also a terrible doctor. I never got my contacts, by the way. One of the "nurses" threated me with my life, screaming. She called security on me and refused to give me my contacts. Well, never going there again! I went home with bruises. There are so many eye doctors in Mobile, Daphne, and Fairhope. Go anywhere but here! Save yourself from having my experience. Such unprofessional people. And there manager "Sarah" is also just as worse as the rest of them.

name: Yam alyami
text: This review only for the Doctor Office not for the classes shop. Its very very over priced, and whoever manage this place is unprofessional. I am foreign And i went to them last November and i had an eye exam for $249. i have been doing eye exam for years and the charge rate around $75. Dont go to this place

name: Laurie Watson McKay
text: Got glasses, prescription for glasses, and prescription for contacts. Called six months later and they have no record of me in their files. Incompetent.

name: T Rye
text: never again

name: Hernandez Foote
text: The service was really amazing. The staff was very friendly and very informative all while being welcoming. I would highly recommend LensCrafters to anyone looking for a new location to get their glasses.

name: Streetninja 0909
text: The staff, the Doctor, and the experience was top notch.  I greatly appreciate the knowledge and expertise they have.  They are all very nice people as well.  This is how you do customer service.  Thank you!

resp.text: Thank You Roland for the 5-Star Review.  We appreciate you taking the time to let us know how we are doing.  We look forward to continuing to help with your eye care in the future. Thanks Again!!

name: Lisa Brazeal
text: Great bunch of people!  They do a great job and are very efficient. Would recommend them.

name: Jared Fulford
text: I am amazed at how reasonable vision world is!!! The staff are extremely nice and helpful. The doctor was very nice and I have only been here for about 20 minutes. They are fitting the lenses to my frames as I am writing this review. I highly recommend vision world to anyone who needs glasses!!!!!

resp.text: Thank you Jared for the 5 Star review. We appreciate you letting us and others know how pleased you were with our service!

name: Ryan Rutoskey
text: Vision world is amazing. I have never enjoyed any type of medical visit anywhere. It’s just not me. However, I’ve been here multiple times and can say I have always walked out smiling. The people who work here and warm and inviting and do their best to have you walk out with instant improvement. 100% recommend to people of all ages.

resp.text: Thanks Ryan ! We appreciate the excellent review !  Thank you for letting us help with your vision care.

name: Amy Vought
text: Friendly and caring staff that go out of their way to make sure you see perfect out of your new glasses! Thank you Vision World in Opelika for making sure my new progressive lenses are perfect. This is the first vision place I have been to that gives this kind of customer service, thank you! Customer service is the most important thing you can offer to your customers and you have exceeded my exceptions! Thank you! Amy V.

resp.text: Thank You Amy, we appreciate the 5 STAR review! We are glad to know that you are enjoying your new glasses.

name: Jasmine Chang
text: Love the employees! They are super sweet and caring. They took care of all of my problems within 30 minutes. Received my contacts the next day :) Very satisfied with this place!

resp.text: Thank you Jasmie for the kind review.  Sorry it took so long to respond, just now seeing this.

name: Jacob Jones
text: Super friendly staff. I have never walked into a place and been known immediately on a first visit. I was treated like I had been coming there for years, and this instantly made me feel comfortable and welcome. They took an interest in my life, but they weren't intrusive. The doctor asked about my career and what I do, and chatted about it. I'm not sure how my second visit will go, but the first impression is the best first impression I have ever gotten anywhere. Go here!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind review!

name: Cameron Westbrook
text: Could not have been any nicer or more professional.  I worried about getting my Warby Parker frames adjusted, so I called to make sure they would be able to do it.  They assured me they could for a $5 fee (which I think is more than reasonable for a professional adjustment).  I was in and out in 5 minutes, despite them being relatively busy when I arrived.  I'd definitely recommend Vision World to all the fellow four-eyed folks out there.

name: Cassandra Johnson
text: Vision World in Opelika have the best customer service very friendly people very helpful they where very patient with me with chosen my glasses the doctor took his time explaining everything to me Ben is super helpful and very friendly And Samantha is sweet as she want to be if u need any eye care service I highly recommend u go to Vision World IN Opelika Alabama

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind review. We look forward to helping your daughter. You were a great customer.  Customers like you make my job fun.

name: Allen Beard
text: Samantha was very friendly and professional.  Fixed my glasses while we waited, replaced my wife's lenses that day.  Would recommend them.

name: Abigail Rose
text: The people were extremely friendly and helpful!

resp.text: Thank you for the excellent review Abigail. We appreciate your business!

name: Ashley Ozyurt
text: Very courteous staff, little to no wait. Best in Auburn.

resp.text: Thank you Ashley! I am sorry that I am just now responding to your review.  Thank you for continuing to let us take care of you and your families eye care needs.

name: Korina Hornbuckle
text: Me and my grandmother went here on Friday and they told her she wouldn't get her glasses till Monday then called about an hour later and said they were ready

resp.text: Thank your for your 5 Star review. It is very much appreciated!

name: Dustan Stephenson
text: Almost no wait , very friendly staff even helped with my 5 and 1 year old I had to bring in with me.

resp.text: Thanks for the review Dustan.  We hope to see y'all back soon!

name: Beckie Allen
text: always caring, friendly and knowledgeable.  I have been wearing glasses since i was 8 years old. I have had several eye doctors but Dr. Olive is by far the best! He is personable, and I have learned more about my vison from seeing him than I did before.  His staff is friendly and helpful.

name: Deborah Mitchell
text: Awesome experience!!  Super kind and supportive staff and amazing doctor!  I highly recommend Dr. Olive!

name: Cynthia Beasley
text: They have always been very nice and helpful. We recommend them.

name: Ron Norsworthy
text: I had a small emergency and they stayed open past normal hours to assist.  I also have used them for my eyeglasses in the past.  The entire "team" has always been fantastic in all aspects of customer service and quality.

name: Tiffany Hilyer
text: Very nice and pleasant experience

name: Streetninja 0909
text:
Horrible experience with a very, very rude doctor.
Update (9.18.18 - 1 year after previous review) They told me to never come back to their establishment in August of 2017 but they sent me an appointment reminder card.   Please stop harassing me!

name: Don Ayres
text: We are well satisfied with Dr Olive, very professional!

name: mara kimbrough
text: During this Pandemic, a lot of businesses make you feel somewhat uncomfortable but I’m pleased to say. I felt comfortable the entire time. The entire staff made my 1st visit second to none. I’ve found where I need to be.!Kudos to all I encountered on last Saturday.

resp.text: We are so happy that you had a positive experience Mara. Thank you so much for taking the time to give us a five star review. We look forward to seeing you in the future!

name: Tia Harding
text: Absolutely loved my experience and Dr. Harvey was amazing. The receptionist helped me pick out the perfect shade for but dual lenses for my glasses! My contacts were a perfect fit and the selection of glasses was great. They don’t have many but the frames they have are definitely in style. I would recommend this office for great service and quality. The office was very clean an the followed Covid protocol to the T. When I came I sat in my car and texted them upon arrival so I they would let me know when to come in and they were ready to take me at my exact appointment time! If I could give them 6 stars I would!

resp.text: Thank you so much Tia! Have a great day.

name: Courtney Finnen
text: Dr Harvey is the best. I have seen many eye doctors and she is the only one who has been so persistent in finding the perfect prescription and contact lenses for me. I’m always in and out super quickly. The lady at the front desk (I wish I could remember her name) is always so sweet. I love Dr Harvey and will never see anyone else.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind review and we look forward to seeing you again!

name: Mindy Broom
text: I visited the office recently, the doctor and receptionist were both very friendly and inviting. The office staff were taking extra precautions due to Covid-19. The scheduling was kept at a minimal so that social distancing could be observed. 100% happy with my visit and my prescription was perfect. Most definitely will continue using these facility! Thanks for everyone.

resp.text: Mindy, Thank you so much for taking the time to leave us a review and we look forward to seeing you in the future!

name: Isaac S
text: Best eye doctor I've ever seen, Dr. Harvey is wonderful and cares about her work (extremely knowledgeable) and Angela is a great receptionist. Received my glasses in 2 days, very fast workers. 10/10 , no doubt!

resp.text: Isaac, thank you so much for the kind words and 5 star review. It is our pleasure to take care of you at InSight Eye Group.

name: Syd & Tay's Adventures
text: Fantastic experience!! The staff and Dr are super friendly and helpful. Making an appointment on their website was so easy.  The office was super clean.  I can't say enough good things.  We drove from an hour away because of a groupon. And because of the excellent service we will continue driving here!

resp.text: Thank you so much. It was our pleasure!

name: Aliyah Little
text: Dr.Harvey is  Phenomenal been seeing her for over 13years!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the 5 star review Aliyah!

name: Jimmy Parrish
text:
My mother has followed Dr. Harvey for years she has been under her care. Our family goes here also. A caring  and wonderful staff. A caring understanding  doctor  and staff. You become their family as you see and feel complete eye care given at it's best.
To Dr. Harvey  & Staff , our thanks for being there.
My mother is Debra McBooth Parrish

name: Elizabeth Maples
text: The whole group is wonderful!  Dr. Harvey pays close attention to her patients and has such a warm spirit. Angela will greet you with a blessing!

name: alexis pritchett
text: Great customer service and very professional! Dr. Harvey was very helpful and nice , you can tell she  truly cares about her patients. Highly recommend. If I could give it more stars I would !

name: Garland Naftel
text: Very friendly staff and Dr Harvey was thorough, professional. Very pleased with visits.

resp.text: Thank you so much. It is our pleasure to be your eye care provider!

name: Kanika Reese
text: Was referred by my best friend and I love her the same. Great doctor. Caring and a great listener. She also realized my previous optometrist has me in a stronger rx for glasses and that's why it was hard for me to see. She is great!

name: LL Lou
text: Such nice ladies! They’re very prompt with appointments and I never have to wait more than 10 minutes. Love this place

name: Chris Catanzano
text: Love Dr. Harvey and Ms. Angela

name: Alexis Kaye
text: Probably my favorite place to go for an eye exam from now on. Friendly staff and I felt like I was in and out of there very quickly.

name: Inger Jackson
text: Very personable and professional.  She remembers patient and personal info about us.  My entire family sees her and she know immediately who we are.  She is fantastic.

name: Andrell Hubbard
text: Dr. Harvey is the best! She is very kind and knowledgeable. I've been seeing her for nearly 10 years now and I wouldn't have it any other way!

name: Sonja D
text: Dr. Harvey really takes the time out with each patient and makes you feel very comfortable and special.  My whole family loves her!  She is definitely the greatest!!!!

name: Connie Stoves
text: Finding a place  for  my 4  Grandkids was al ready  difficult, but  when I spoke  with Angela,  before  I  met  Dr. Harvey , I was  sold ,  if  every  office  had and assistant  to  greet  you , get  your  information  and pep the kids ,  taking your  Kids or  grandkids  to  any  appointment would be  a  breeze ,.Two  thumbs up to Dr. Harvey ,  for  a  great assistant  like  Angela

name: eric coggins
text: They take entirely to long to receive your glasses and they don't listen well. Thank GOD I'm not blind....

resp.text: Eric, first off I want to thank you for bringing this to my attention and I apologize for your experience.  Our patient care and satisfaction is extremely important to us. We always strive to exceed our patient's expectations. Please contact me personally to discuss. Dr. Harvey

name: Emma Siebu
text: Dr.Harvey has a true gift for eye care. She is not just an eye doctor.  She has a passion. For her work.

name: Shawn Bell
text: Very nice, friendly, professional and also informative.

name: ANIL PATEL
text: Best Eye Dr. Harvey

name: Lexi Lou
text: Love, Love, Love Dr Harvey. She is amazing!!!!

name: Tommy Lovejoy
text: Very satisfied!!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much. We appreciate you!

name: Roxann Knox
text: Excellent

name: Trevor
text: Blaire was excellent. She helped me pick glasses that fit my fat head while keeping me from looking like too much of a dork. Great service, great selection, knowledgeable and friendly.

resp.text: Hi! Thank you so much for your review. We are excited to hear that Blaire was able to help make your experience in LensCrafters a great one. We look forward to seeing you again!

name: Karen Veazey
text: I wanted to use my old frames, but my old lenses were really hard to remove.  Other businesses I had gone to were afraid to take my old lenses out for fear the frames might break.  But Blaire at this LensCrafters location fearlessly popped out the old lenses and put in the new ones perfectly.  Thank you so much, Blaire!

resp.text: Hi! Thank you so much for your review. We are excited to hear Blaire was able to help make your experience in LensCrafters a great one. We look forward to seeing you again!

name: CRS2561
text: I have been going here for several years and I have NO complaints. I had to go today because my dog ate my glasses 😟. Blaire helped me today and was excellent. She was helpful , attentive , and very nice. A great experience overall. Thanks !!!

resp.text: Hi! Thank you so much for your review. We are excited to hear Blaire was able to help make your experience in LensCrafters a great one. We look forward to seeing you again!

name: Samantha Pace
text: I was very happy with my experience at this location! Blaire was super helpful and I was able to walk out of the mall wearing my new glasses in an hour!

resp.text: Hi! Thank you so much for your review. We are excited to hear Blaire was able to help make your experience in LensCrafters a great one. We look forward to seeing you again!

name: Mark Gardiner
text: I was traveling from Arizona and broke the frame for my glasses shortly after arriving in Huntsville, AL.  LensCrafters fit me in as an emergency and were able to repair my glasses so I could get my work done and get back home to get a new pair.  I really appreciated the accommodation and helping me out when I needed them. Thank you!

resp.text: Awesome to hear! We are happy to hear about your positive experience and look forward to serving you again!

name: Katie Noonan
text:
Will NEVER go back & Not recommended!
My son and I drove over an hour for an eye exam. Not only were they none attentive, but did nothing but rush & try pushing my teenage son to switch from glasses to contacts. Instead of giving a teenager time to think about whether he was comfortable with contacts or wearing them, they insisted on forcing you to pay for a lesson and a contact exam on top of his glasses exam before making a decision. After leaving the first time with a horrible experience, we got a call that his lenses were in after 2 weeks. Then, after calling to make sure they’d have time to complete the service before driving the distance again, we get there to be told they had ordered the wrong lenses for his frame. The frame in which he specifically had with him at his first visit & had taken a picture of with him in them. The employees were unfriendly, unconcerned, and sat there arguing with me about them having more than one frame listed in the system for him as an excuse. Regardless of the fact that his current frames were there with him on his exam visit & they were responsible for making sure they ordered the lenses for that exact frame! They completely disregarded checking the frame model he had with him before ordering the new lenses I paid $362 for, and we were not only out of another long drive for nothing, but ended up being  left without him having his glasses. Completely unacceptable! Do not waste your time with this location.

resp.text: Hello Katie, thank you so much for sharing your experience. At LensCrafters our goal is to set the standard in quality in eye care and eyewear by ensuring every patient and customer has the best experience in every location every time. We apologize that we did not exceed your expectations during your visit. We value our customer’s feedback!  Please go to https://www.luxotticacustomercare.com/lenscrafters to provide your information so we can contact you and work to resolve the issue.

name: Timothy Allen
text: The assistant manager at the Parkway Place Lenscrafters was knowledgeable and extremely helpful. She made the whole experience pleasant and easy. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you for your review! Our associates strive to provide the best possible service. We are happy to hear about your positive experience and look forward to seeing you again!

name: Erin Lacer
text: Justin really helped me and get my glasses fixed I really do appreciate him

resp.text: Thank you for your review! Our associates strive to provide the best possible service. We are happy to hear about your positive experience and look forward to seeing you again!

name: Carter
text: Once again, very happy.  I like this place so much I went outside my eye insurance coverage.  My appointment was set for 11:30.  I arrived 25 min early like usual.  They were exactly on time.  Something I can appreciate due to the way businesses are ran nowadays.  Businesses don't seem to care about customers time.  This place definitely cares about time.  The doctor is a sweet as she can be and very informative.  Office staff was very professional and polite.  This is amy second time visiting and this is myy second review.  Would not go anywhere else.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! Our associates strive to provide the best possible service. We are happy to hear about your positive experience and look forward to seeing you again!

name: Lori Brooks
text: This location is wonderful.  I will continue to be a faithful customer for years to come.  Dr. Letson is great with my kids!  The eyewear staff is top notch!  They are always friendly and willing adjust or repair my kiddos glasses while making them laugh and enjoy the visit to the store.  The staff know how to help you find the right frame and lenses that fit your lifestyle and budget.  Great job, guys!!

resp.text: Thank you for your review! Our associates strive to provide the best possible service. We are happy to hear about your positive experience and look forward to serving you again!

text: I was shocked at how quick and efficient the lady that helped me was. Never had anyone get me out of the store so fast.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! Our associates strive to provide the best possible service. We are happy to hear about your positive experience and look forward to serving you again!

resp.text: Thank you for your review! We are happy to hear your experience was great from start to finish. We look forward to serving you again.

resp.text: Thank you for your review! Our associates strive to provide the best possible service. We are happy to hear about your positive experience and look forward to serving you again!

text: Alt account. So slow and unaccommodating. Although I came early, I ended up leaving after waiting two hours for an exam. Take your buisiness elsewhere if you can, it’s not worth the money nor traffic you have to fight to get to the mall.

name: Lindsay Cannon
text: I'm a fraidy cat of things coming at my eyes and Dr Melanie Cox made everything go smooth. She was very patient and was just so very personable. She was everything that could have been good for me in that whole appointment.

name: Dusty Patrick
text: The Guy that sold me my glasses is great at his job very polite and knowledgeable give him a raise as far as i am concerned he was helpful enough i bought my glasses there and i plan to bring my wife there for her glasses!!!

resp.text: That’s great news! We appreciate your review and hope to see you again!

name: Kyzmen
text: Very nice store! Love the staff!!

resp.text: Thank you for your review. Our associates are some of the best around and we are always happy to hear our customers feel the same!

name: Presley Frederick
text: Lenscrafters at ParkPlace has always been very helpful in choosing the right lenses and frames. I have have been going here for years. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Hi Presley! Thank you for your review! We appreciate the feedback and look forward to serving you again!

name: Nathan Slate
text: Great customer service with people that genuinely care about people.  I personally don't wear glasses but had an eye emergency on a weekend and with little notice they went out of their way to help me out. Thank you so much.

resp.text: Hi Nathan! Thank you for your review. Our associates are some of the best around and we are always happy to hear our customers feel the same! We look forward to serving you again!

name: Zoe Hooker
text: My husband and I live near Nashville and I was in an emergency situation at 5pm on a Saturday when I found myself without any glasses - we called every glasses store in the Nashville/Middle Tennessee area and no one could help us until the following Monday or Tuesday. We called this LensCrafters and Caleb was amazing with us. He said to drive on down (the hour and a half away) and he would make sure we were taken care of. Him and Karen were absolutely amazing and the perfect example of customer service and care. They even stayed after hours to make the lenses and make sure we were taken care of. Thank you so much for all your amazing service!

resp.text: Hi Zoe, thank you for your review. Our associates are some of the best around and we are always happy to hear our customers feel the same!

name: Jonathan M
text: I was traveling and needed to get a replacement pair of glasses.  They refused to honor a prescription from another office and required me to get a new prescription from them in order to buy glasses.  I’ve never had this issue at any other LensCrafters location.

resp.text: Hi Jonathan, thank you for your review. We are sorry to hear about your experience and would like to learn more. Please go to bit.ly/LC-LUX so we can follow up with you directly.

name: Nichole Jarvis
text: Jason is just the best! Zach isnt too bad either. Karen is very cool. The whole staff is comprised of ROCKSTARS.

name: Angel Shorty
text: I needed an appointment as soon as possible due to my dog chewing up my glasses. I was very pleased with them getting me in as fast as they did and they worked with me when I was late because of traffic. They exam went very well, the doctor was very friendly. However, when they exam was over and I went to pick out the lenses to go in the frames I had picked out, the lady did not give me the options of lenses I could receive same day. Here I am thinking that I am going to get them same day, but don't find out that it could be a week before I actually get my glasses until after I make the payment. I should have been given the same day options first knowing that I have no glasses until those come in. I am now going on a week without glasses.

name: Thatmanstu MotoConcepts
text: Everyone was courteous, helpful and professional.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. Our associates are some of the best around and we are always happy to hear our customers feel the same!

name: Linda McClendon
text: Excellent customer service and frame selection. We were in and out in 45 minutes (We provided the RX). Text message received within 30 minutes that single vision eyeglasses were ready. A little pricey so removed one star.

name: Nathan Owens
text: This location has the absolute worst customer service I have ever experienced for any medical exam.  My schedule appointment was at 10 am and they did not get me back until past 11:30!  The front desk lady was completely rude and had no patience when it came to any questions.  I had to return a second time to follow up for my contacts.  The same front desk lady ignored us for 30 minutes when we tried to sign in.  She flirted with some young adult men for another 30 minutes after she acknowledge we were there - I guess chatting with a friend is more important than a customer.

name: andrea sharp
text: Was not impressed.  I felt like the optometrist rushed me through as fast as she could.  The only good thing there was a very nice worker helped me find the right frames for my face.  Will not be back to the optometrist.

name: Ryan Coons
text: I ordered lenses for my existing frames at the LensCrafters at the Parkway Place Mall in Huntsville, AL. However, I cannot get them installed into my frames because one of the lenses is the wrong size. Despite the time and expense of grinding a bifocal lens, it never occurred to anyone involved to question lens sizes. Due to my on-call status and vacation plans, I can't receive my correct lenses for at least three weeks. I had to use up leave from work to arrive before the lab closed; I will never get those hours of leave back. I have to spend even more leave time to return, since LensCrafters can't do a job right the first time. I should not have trusted LensCrafters with this important job.

name: Nikki Nicole
text: I went to this location for the first time because I was already at the mall. Usually I go to the one on university drive per closer to my home. However, I was pleased with the customer service that I received, the beautiful lady went above and beyond to help me find glasses that compliment my face.

name: Anthony C. Wilkerson
text: I have been going here for the past 3 years and all of that is mute because of the horrible experience I had over the phone. I felt like the rep did not show any empathy for me being a dissatisfied customer and made no effort to try and make me a happy customer.

name: Edward Brewer
text: Get a good novel to read you'll be here several hours. Had a 4:30 appointment and it's now 6:30 and I still haven't seen the optometrist.

name: Victoria True
text: Wish I could give zero stars. Really rude people. Especially over the phone.

resp.text: Hi Victoria, thank you for your review. We apologize for your experience as we aim to consistently meet and surpass customers' expectations. Please go to bit.ly/LC-Support so we can follow up with you directly.

name: Pamela Hideko
text: One semi rude staff member & one that was very pleasant

name: Harrison Gough
text: Justin at lensecrafters in the mall did an awesome job changing out the lenses in my persols, even as they had a crack in them. Also, he straightened them out and conformed them to my face. They feel better than ever now. Thanks Justin!

name: Caitlyn Harris
text: I've had problems with my vision for 13 years or so, and I had the BEST experience with the vision center; not only is the doctor amazing, the entire support staff she has is just as kind. Those that work at the counter near the glasses are very helpful and knowledgeable as well! I'll give a special shout-out to Melinda because she was truly one of the most pleasant people I've ever spoken to; she's been in the eyeglasses business for some time now, so she has great tips and tricks for us glasses wearers! Thank you, Melinda!

name: Craig Winn
text: Location has changed recently. It is now up by the cash registers. Always busy...too busy. Hard to get help. They make great glasses though. Pricing is also excellent on their glasses and they take most insurance. They have an eye doctor on site.

name: Miss Ro
text: So after reading these reviews, I was very skeptical about trying this place.😕 Upon arrival to my appointment, I instantly regretted the decision. 😒 I was told that my appointment was the day before. 😦However, this is not what I was told when I made the appointment and put the date in my calendar. 🧐 The staff was very accommodating though and offered me another appointment for later that day. 🙃 Then I was sent a text stating that I had missed the other appointment 🤨. Surprisingly, the doctor’s visit was amazing. 😋 She was friendly, easy to talk to, extremely knowledgeable and very professional. Dr. Compton ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

name: Jenna Reardanz
text: Dr. Emily Compton was great! Answered any questions I had in a very knowledgeable way. The whole office was very friendly and efficient. Also great COVID precaution!

name: Lucas “Doc” Dockendorff
text: We drive all the way from Shreveport, LA to see Dr. Rubino. I don't think there is much else I could tell you that tops a 7 hour drive with an infant for an eye exam. They should have a secret 6th star.

name: Jan Gautro
text: Have bought at least 4 or of glasses and received nothing but excellent service from the vision dept!  They are as conscientious as they can be with as busy as they are!  Never dealt with the Dr there but the rest of the staff is knowledgeable & helpful!  Can’t say enough good things about them and the prices can’t be beat!!!

name: Lee Franklin
text: Ignore the matched "Harris" 1 star reviews (So blatantly from same people), no sympathy for someone who shows up so late for an appointment.  I have been using Dr Rubino for years and she continues to amaze me, and the quality, knowledge and cost of glasses in the vision center is amazing.  One of the best places you can go.  Don't show up at 4:50 for a 4:30 appointment, though.  =)

name: Jim McDade
text: I have purchased three pair of eyeglasses at Costco for personal use. The first pair was fine. The last two pairs both fell apart in less than two years. Very disappointing and all the employees said was that they were sorry about it, but couldn't do anything. The metal nose pad post fell off of my second pair and I didn't notice it until a small abrasion caused by the rough spot where the post was anchored started to bleed after a few hours of wear. The second pair that failed (Perry Ellis) brand worked well for about a year before mysterious striations began to appear in the lenses. These were not scratches. I took the glasses to Costco and all the tech did was scratch her head and ask me what I had done to them. I am 60 and have been wearing eyeglasses since I was 13, so I know how to take care of my glasses. A close inspection revealed that the Perry Ellis frames were shrinking over time, placing constant stress on the lens material. I will never buy eyeglasses from Costco again. It looks like normal UV exposure from sunlight (I go to ball games a lot), caused the organic bonds in the frame material to slowly break down, resulting in the shrinkage. They were just low-quality frames with a fancy designer name on them.

name: John Allen
text: I had my eye exam and bought a pair of glasses at 12:30 on a Saturday. Costco members will know that 12:30 on Saturday is about the craziest time there is at Costco. Dr. Rubino was courteous, efficient, and most importantly, thorough. The staff at the frame and lens sales counter were just as courteous and efficient. I genuinely felt that they met my needs for a prescription and glasses, and there is no doubt that I got a great value out of my glasses and lenses. If you don't have any pressing ophthalmic issues, you are cheating yourself by not using Dr. Rubino and Costco

name: Shawn Shallow
text: Made an appointment.  Waited 30 minutes and got bumped for somebody that skipped their earlier appointment.  Decided not to wait 60 minutes and left.  All I can say is don’t bother.  Service is terrible.

name: Kacey Harris
text: My daughter (5yrs old) had an appointment with Dr. Rubino today at 4:30. I called at 4:30 and spoke with her letting her know we were close by but we’re going to be a bit late due to traffic from a wreck. She said okay and then called me back at 4:50 (we were in the parking lot at the time) to tell me that she could not see my daughter that they close at 5:00 and she would not have time to see her we would need to reschedule. This was not just a routine eye exam...I had called and made the appointment on Thursday because my daughter has been seeing floaters, which I have learned are not common in children and should be checked out soon. Dr. Rubino was aware of the reason of the appointment and still chose to not see her. I consider this to be very poor bedside manner and extremely unprofessional. I do not recommended going to her.

name: A.B. H***
text: Dr Rubino is friendly and a professional. I was referred to her by a friend and I have referred many to her. The review of two parents who were over 20 minutes late is unfair. How do the reviewers know whether the Dr had her own commitment to keep?  If the issue was that big of a concern they could have gone to Childrens Hospital or the UAB Callahan 24.7 eye emergency room. Dr.  Rubio has spent extra time with me due to changing vision issues and due to some recent health related causes. I have used other optometrists including those at Schaeffer and in other states. She has been the best by far. Highly recommend and I was skeptical due to her office being in Costco.

I ordered glasses and they took over 3 weeks. I do not even have high prescriptions.

I will never go back. And never recommend this place to anyone else

resp.text: We are so sorry to hear that you were upset with the wait time at our office. Having been a long time patient, we hope that you have come to know that this is not the norm in our office. Typically, we ask that our patients allow at least one hour for their complete eye examination, that being said, sometimes exam/wait times may be a little shorter or longer on any given day. As a small practice, we pride ourselves on spending extra time with each patient to give a thorough eye examination, go over diagnoses and answer any questions.  Looking back on the schedule on the particular day that you were here, we did have a staff member out sick and that is likely why we were running a little behind that day.  Again, we apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused you.  Please feel free to call us if you need anything!

text:
They were all really nice. Dr. Silliman is absolutely awesome. He stayed late for me to get my exam. Someone needs to hire some MORE people. But the people that are there really work hard to get EVERYTHING done. They are constantly running around and smiling while doing it.

HOWEVER if you are trying to call and get ANY information about an order you gave them $709 for you’re not going to get it. You get put on hold before you can even say “okay” or no I don’t want to be on hold I’ll just call back. If you aren’t making an appointment you’re forgotten. I got tired of holding after 30 min and called again, someone answered and said I was going to have to hold and I said no I’ll just call back later and she said wel, someone can take your call now.... SHE PUT ME ON HOLD and I sat there for about a minute until I was angry and gave up. All I wanted to know was if they could provide me with an expected delivery date of my glasses because I live pretty far from the office and would like to have a little bit of a plan as to when I’ll have to go back to pick them up. 2 hours later... still no info

Okay I take it back, UPDATE maybe they were having a Monday and I was too because I just called and they were super nice. Sometimes people just have bad days and I may have called on one of those bad days for the whole store. Thank you guys for helping me see. ❤️❤️❤️

resp.text: I’m very sorry you had an unpleasant experience with us.  Thank you for your feedback.  Did they hand-write an ETA on your receipt? Orders can take up to 10 business days, not including weekends or holidays. I'd be happy to have someone from the leadership team reach out to you about this. If you'd like, please email me at americasbest@nationalvision.com.  It’s very important to include the location you visited, your name and your phone number so we can help as quickly as possible. Thank you, Nancy

name: Vanessa Whitfield
text: I had an appt. for over a month, arrived, checked in and was in waiting area when I was told if I didn't wear a mask, they could not provide service.   I explained I had a medical condition and could not wear a mask several times.  I felt discriminated against and embarassed because of the treatment I received.  I will NEVER recommend you guys to anyone.  If everyone else wears a mask and I'm 6 ft from everyone, how can my not wearing a mask affect you? It doesn't.   Makes NO SENSE.  When you can select and chose who you help IT IS DISCRIMINATION.  You lost a lot of business because of how I was treated.  Your business needs to seriously rethink customer service.  It's because of your customers, you have a business.  It is not a law nor even a state mandate that a mask is required.  Medical reason or not, what you did was disgraceful.

resp.text: We apologize for any inconvenience. As a healthcare retail establishment, we are committed to the safety of our customers and associates. Our enhanced COVID-19 protocols can be viewed here https://www.americasbest.com/health-statement. If you have any further questions, please call 855-985-0949 or email HealthandSafety@nationalvision.com. Thank you, Nancy

name: Julie Cartledge
text: My appointment was at 1:30 and I arrived at 1:37 because of traffic delays. I was told I had to reschedule because the doctor had already gone to lunch. Besides the fact that my eye appointment would have taken more than 7 minutes, since when are people not allowed a grace period? The receptionist was quite rude and not willing to offer any explanation except that I had to reschedule. Well, I didn’t reschedule nor will I. I’m taking my business elsewhere.

name: Brenda Gonzalez
text: Great customer service and way more affordable than Schaeffer Eye Center. Dr. Mills is great. The staff has made my experience here great.

name: Pooloo UpInHere
text: To all who value friendly customer service, cleanliness and time, America's Best in Hoover is the place to go. I visited there Tuesday and was in and out. The only problem I encountered was me deciding on the perfect frames. There is a huge selection to choose from and none of them look cheap. I had such a great time there, I will choose all my exams and glasses from this location. The Dr. seemed to care about the health of my eyes and was thorough with all concerns I had. She was a joy as well as the entire staff. Shout out to Jamir for your kindness in trying to repair my old glasses. It was an absolute pleasure interacting with the everyone. Nothing negative here to say...sorry.

resp.text: Thanks so much for taking the time to write a review. We love hearing from happy customers and we appreciate your feedback and your business! – Nancy

name: Kendall Black
text:
Rude, not helpful at all during this time of crisis, sarcastic, and refused to give me the name and number of the supervisor for Angela, the store manager. Our business isn't important to this manager. I will NEVER return to this store and recommend strongly that no one else does either.

UPDATE:  I continued to use this facility, regardless of my past comments and feelings.  All b/c I had their eye care plan.  I shouldn't have done that.  Their eye care plan or whatever it's called is not worth it.  So, if you're a person that reads reviews and takes them to heart.... My advice to you is find an eye doctor that is there every time you go into their office, so you actually SEE the same eye doctor each time.  A doctor that will explain to you what's going on and makes the time to answer your questions.  A doctor that CARES about your eye health or lack there of, depending on the situation.  A doctor and his staff that know what customer service is all about.  A doctor and his staff that will work with you on the health of your eyes.  I'm dealing w/ these people today, b/c I have to.  But I won't do it again.  I don't care if I have to pay twice as much to see another eye physician.  America's Best does not care about it's patients.  Not in the least.  Not at the office level or corporate level.  It's so glaringly obvious.

name: Tony Bruno
text: Everything is an upcharge and it's a real scammy place that wants to sell a yearly membership and runs very misleading ads for free eye exams. I will not be using them again.

name: Ana Aguilar
text: This place is not friendly at all. They have the worst receptionist. She is so rude and I noticed her talking behind my back with the guy that works there. She was so rude to everyone. The only nice person is the Hispanic young lady. Other than that this place is horrible! That receptionist needs to get a warning. Looking at other reviews I am not the only one that thinks she needs a write up!

text: Went for my 3rd visit to get new glasses, and every time I go, it's an amazing experience. The prices are good, the staff is friendly, and the place is always super clean! Recommended it to all my friends and family and they all love it as well!

text: I went in for my appointment and the staff is really friendly. The doctor was great and he took time with me and went over everything. I definitely recommend going here for your eye care needs!

name: Katrina Travis
text: I have been to this location several times . I got my last pair of glasses here and at that time i had no problems . The staff was very helpful and friendly. But this time the receptionist was awful. She was rude. She took my ins card  that clearly had my husbands name and employer information on it. She had me wait for over 20 minutes in the waiting area . I  walked back to the receptionist  desk to find her doing nothing and asked for my ins. card and to find out what was taking so long and she stated oh I haven’t ran your ins yet but you do have VSP . SO , I’m like how do you know that if you have not looked into the information. So she said I will in a minute very rudely. I had to ask her to pull my file if she needed additional info and  told her that i was not a new customer, everything should be in my file nothing had changed. She rolled her eyes and just sat there looking as if I was bothering her.  Then she finally looked up and said I need your husbands DOB and the last four of his social on this sticky note and you can have a seat. I said no ma’am run my ins and give me my card back please. By then they were calling me to the back for my exam. Let me just say the rest of my appointment went well . The Hispanic lady did well with helping me with my contacts ,but i honestly think they have lost a customer . I don’t have time for attitudes where I’m spending my money. I even ordered my contacts to be delivered to my address so I wouldn’t have to go back to the store and I will probably order my glasses online from another company.

name: Tiffany Walls
text:
I had a wonderful experience at this location. It had been about 5 years since my last eye exam. I used to suffer from horrible migraines (which I seem to have remedied) and I still do suffer from pretty frequent headaches and some other minor issues (floaters, some blurring in my vision, straining with low-light situations).

Facy was the front office associate that greeted me and verified my insurance. She was VERY sweet and helpful.

Linda did my preliminary eye exam and field testing. She was very kind, very patient and overall pleasant to interact with.

Dr. Mills is AMAZING. She is such a kind human being, she listened thoroughly while I talked about my history and concerns. She did not lose patience or make me feel rushed during my eye exam (especially when I had difficulty deciding between which two lenses looked more clear). We chatted while she checked out my eyes after dilation and she was just a joy. I love love love the experience I had with her and the fact that she is a WOC sealed the deal for me.

Cecily was a peach and walked us through what insurance would cover, our many options for lenses and frames and was able to play with some numbers so that we were able to get the most bang for our buck based on our needs.

I'll come here to update about receiving our glasses, the fitting and how things turned out but the experience overall was wonderful!

***Our glasses were ready for pickup 5 days after our appointments! We both got multiple phone calls letting us know they were ready.

The only reason that I couldn't quite give a 5 star review was that some of the staff that worked in the front were not as polite and patient (my wife didn't have such a great experience with the person who assisted her at first). Everything else was fabulous and we intend to make this our home for vision care even though it's in Hoover and we live in Calera. It was worth it!

resp.text: Hi Tiffany, Thanks so much for taking the time to write a review, we appreciate your business and look forward to helping you with your eye care and eye wear needs in the future. – Nancy
