name: Pamila Rodriguez
text: When I made my appointment they told us they were going to be taking people on a first come first serve basis, that they would start seeing patients at 6:30 in the evening now. So I got here at 6 o'clock to be kind early because I didn't have a lot of time to waste.  When I saw how they were doing it I went to the reception desk and told them that I did not have two hours to be here. They assured me it would be about 20 minutes because there was only four people ahead of us. It is now been more than two hours and I'm still waiting. People that came in and filled out paperwork after us have already done been seen and left.  I've been coming here six years  such a horrible experience. If they don't get this fixed I won't be coming back

name: Kabrina Nickell
text: Horrible customer service. The lady who works the front desk is very unpleasant, and not a friendly person. It took 2 hours to be seen she stated that everyone came the day she made my appointment on. When I picked up my children's glasses very rude again and did not even fit the children's glasses and when I asked for a case she said you do not get a case. Who gives a 9 year old autistic child glasses without a case. Never will I do business there again.

name: William Creech
text: I bought a new set of eyeglasses, frames and lenses.  The lenses kept falling out and they kept "fixing" them.  But they continued to fall out.   Finally the last time I returned them they said they would get send them back to where they were made so they could remake them properly.  After a month and not receiving a call from them, I went to their store.  They couldn't tell me anything but that they would call me with the status.  After a week of not receiving a call from them, I called their store.  The only thing they would tell me was they would call me when the come in.  I have been wearing glasses for 54 years and I have never had such poor service and strongly recommend you do not use the Optical Shop.  They have terrible service and just don't give a damn.

name: jeillanpa
text: Best people ever 🙌🏼 Wouldn't go anywhere else!!!!

name: Sherry Stender
text:
I took my son into the Optical shop at 2011 US Hwy 280, Phenix city AL 36867 on 8/1/2016 for a scheduled eye exam. I was using Medicaid to cover the cost of the exam. They checked his eyes and told me that he needs glasses full-time. He was very upset with the news, but we picked out some frames anyway. The selection of Medicaid covered glasses was terrible and cheap looking, so I paid out of pocket for the frames we picked in the amount of $211.00.
I received a call that his glasses were ready for pickup on 8/5/2016. I took him in to get them fitted to his face and out of curiosity and clarity I asked Dr. Michael Redus, that performed the eye exam, again if they were for full-time wear. He responded yes.
A day or two went by, my child wore glasses to the first day of school and I started to question if he could see better with the glasses. He said that he could tell no difference. I put the glasses to my eyes and could tell no difference from the way I normally see. I decided to go for a second opinion.
I took him to Walmart Vision Center on US Hwy 280 and paid for another $70 eye exam out of pocket. That doctor told me that my child did not only have no use for the glasses, but he had 20/20 vision. I have documentation of both visits. One from The Optical shop stating he was prescribed glasses and that it was .075 in each eye. The Walmart one states 20/20 vision with no prescription needed.
I went back to Optical Shop after my visit with the Dr. at Walmart and brought it to his attention. I was told that they were only for reading when before the Dr. said full-time wear. I told them how awful of them it was to prescribe glasses to a 7 year old child that they don’t even need. They refunded my money, but its sad to see a business lie just to make a buck.

name: Evelyn Dunn
text: Very pleasant

name: Warren Crow
text: It had been some time between visits to an optometrist and my more regular ophthalmologists. I found the three assistants and one optometrist to be empathetic to my situation which I think is rare. I was treated well and taken care of by all. I think the eye exam series was the most comprehensive I have ever had. Being in my 60s I had conversations which included discussions of multifocal contact lenses and cataracts plus premium IOL choices. I loved the visit and will continue with this group. I am lined up for a multifocal contact lens fitting (why can't I be without glasses) and know I need an eyeglass pair with new prescription to back up contact lens use.

name: ST FU
text: My (now former) eye doctor requested unnecessary tests. It took months and several unreturned messages to get someone to answer my questions. The office staff and manager were not helpful and lacked urgency in returning my calls. When my call was finally returned the manager was not helpful nor cheerful. They did not care to listen to me as a patient and because of all these issues I do not recommend.

resp.text: Hello, I'm Cassie. I'm so sorry to hear about these tests and the difficulty you had reaching us, as well as the treatment by our staff -- this is definitely not the experience we want for our patients! I'd like to learn more about what happened. Could you please email me at cassiegoodwin@eyecare-partners.com when you have a moment? Again, I'm very sorry about this. I hope to hear from you soon.

name: lexi ivan
text: I was sent back within 10 minutes of my appointment time. The assistant was very efficient with the preliminary testing. Dr. Hines was very kind and informative. When I told her I wanted monthly contacts instead of dailies, she understood and didn't try to force dailies on me like many doctors. The rep in the frames room went above and beyond to help me pick out frames I was happy with. My first pair came two days after my appointment, and my second pair will be in within 2 weeks. I was very happy with my visit!

name: Erika McDonald
text: Everyone who works here is wonderful but Dr. Schwertz is really above and beyond fabulous! She listens and takes her time to address all concerns you may have and she truly advocates for her patients and what is in their best interest. She provides wonderful care and I highly recommend her.

name: Cindy Bynum
text: I highly recommend these guys! They are so great, efficient, and friendly. I see Dr. White, and she's phenomenal. She ensures to carefully explain everything and address any and every issue I have. You can tell they take great pride in their work and are very thorough. 5+ stars for these guys.

name: Jody Wilson
text: I experienced a long wait time when I went in last week. The Doctor is great. I think if your appointment is at 9:20, you should be seen within 20 minutes. I will admit the I am impatient. All of my other appointments at other establishments see me within 5 minutes.  What’s the point in having a appointment, if you can’t be seen around that time.

name: Jameisha Large
text: Excellent staff and service. I loved the atmosphere it was pleasant and welcoming. I really liked Dr. White he made me feel valued and my exam was informative and comfortable. I did not meet one rude person and neither was I left unattended when I was shopping for eyewear. So heck yeah I will be referring people to this location. Five Stars is what you deserve!

name: Lem Motlow
text: Will be changing offices due to the very poor time management and lack of respect for patients time. Every year i have been going for the past four i have had to wait for at least an hour for Dr. Hines. she is very good and pleasant , however either her or the office scheduling is not good. this is not a COVID issue. this has been each year. I work less than 1/4 mile from this location and with at least 4 other office co workers who use her and  like her but not her time management and lack of respect for patients time as many of us come on our lunch break. i understand emergency come up and may have to wait longer than usual due to unseen circumstances once in awhile but when its every year and joked about at office with co workers who use location office and Dr. then it is not us its YOU

resp.text: Lem, I'm Cassie. I'm so sorry to hear about the delays you've experienced visiting our office. I'd like to look into why this is happening -- could you please email me at cassiegoodwin@eyecare-partners.com when you have a moment? Again, I'm very sorry about this. I hope to hear from you soon.

name: Larry Futrell
text: Staff very friendly and professional. Dr. Hang is friendly, professional and very thorough with her exams. I always look forward to my appointments because the atmosphere there is delightful and very amiable!

name: Forrest Plummer
text: My first visit to the Hoover location. I was more than impressed with the professionalism by each associate from the front counter all the way around. Kara took care of all the preliminary tests and was beneficial in making me comfortable as I felt I was bombing several eye tests. Dr. Amos was very helpful explaining everything as she went along. I am looking forward to many years to come.

name: April Taylor
text: The entire staff was amazing when we had our first visit there a couple of weeks ago. My daughter and I were made very comfortable and the exam was very thorough. Dr. Hang is wonderful and easy to talk to. We will be coming back here and also bringing the hubby and my other daughter!

name: Fredia Dillard
text: Great place! Love Dr. Amos. I've been with her for 10 years now. She understands my issues and truly listens. She does not rush through an exam and will offer options.

name: Dawn Kirkland
text: Rob Pate and his staff are wonderful.  I always feel like they are so glad to see me and I have a deep level of confidence in the care I am receiving.  I have recommended Dr. Pate to everyone I have talked to who needs a great eye doctor--in fact, my husband is there this morning!

name: Teala McDowell
text: I had a wonderful experience at EyeCare Associates in Hoover! Dr. Amos definitely ranks at the top of the list not only for her physician skills, but also for her amazing care and concern for her patients, personally. I have been recommending her to all of my Alabama friends! If you are reading this review as you look for someone to take wonderful care of your eye needs, look no more...you found her!

name: Michelle Riley
text: From the time you enter the front door until you leave, you will experience excellent customer service. I recently move to Northern Alabama and I have no plans whatsoever to change eye doctors. I will gladly do the long drive.  They have modern equipment, clean and attractive office space and knowledgeable team members.  I'm sure all the doctors are great but I'm on Team Amos!

name: Derrick Mendez
text: As a patient of Dr. Hammond's for over 10 years, I continue recommend her to anyone I encounter who's in search of an eye care professional.  She is always willing to take the extra step to make sure her patients (which include several members of my family) are taken care of.

name: Marilyn Martin
text: I've been with Dr. Amos for about 38 years and always want her to check out my eyes.  She is very professional but also very friendly.  I recommend her to anyone who needs a wonderful eye doctor.

name: Suzanne Eberhardt
text: My children and I are all patients of Dr. Pate's. It has been a positive experience every time we have been to the office, even when we have walked in without an appointment to get my son's glasses fixed. I have also recommended him to several people and would not hesitate to do it again.

name: Latisha A
text: Today was my first visit and I was very impressed with the entire staff especially Dr. Pate.

name: S B
text: Apparently they changed owners and most of the staff has left.  Dr. Amos was fantastic  as usual but the 2 hour appointment, LONG wait, disorganization and terrible service from everybody else will have me looking elsewhere for my next checkup.

name: Brendolyn Terry
text: I miss dr.pate, but dr. Ansley is good too

name: Christian S
text: They miss represented the quality of the frames they sold me. The metal in the frames fatigued after 6 months and I had to replace them at full cost. This isn't why they get the 1 star. The 1 star is for the poor customer service. I will not return and do not recommend them for purchasing frames/Eyewear.

name: ChaLestar Hill
text: This office is absolutely AWFUL!!! Poor customer service and it takes so long to get your order back. I waited an entire month to hear from them and I have yet to pick up my glasses from them.

name: Kim Hood
text: I have been a patient of Dr. Meyers for almost 20 years. Unfortunately she has sold her practice to Dr. Mansfield and it has not been the same. I recently had an issue with my daughter having frequent headaches so I called to see if I could make an appointment to have her eyes rechecked as I thought her vision might have changed and she needed her glasses adjusted. When the office person called me back, she told me the doctor said if your daughter is having headaches you need to call her pediatrician. We can’t do anything for her. When I went to question and explain more about my daughter’s symptoms and how I felt like they were related to her eyesight the office person got very rude and short with me. I asked to leave a message for Dr. Mansfield to call me back. I still have not received a phone call from her. I called back and asked for Dr. Mansfield’s email address. I wrote her a personal email about the whole situation and still did not receive any type of reply. I called to get mine snd my daughter’s records transferred to a new eye doctor and was never asked if there was an issue or why I was transferring my records. As a health care provider myself, the doctor/patient relationship is very important to me and after you have been seeing a doctor as long as I had in this practice you would think it would be important to them as well. Obviously though by their lack of response I am just a number and not a patient who they truly care to help.

name: Loren Redwood Truitt
text: This optometrist office has really gone above and beyond to insure that all of my vision needs are meet.  I came to the office with a difficult stigmatism and no previous information for them to gage where to begin.  When my contacts were not quite right, they offered me trial pairs to accommodate the box of lenses I purchased and ended up offering me two free visits to optimize my sight to its very best possible.  I’m really blown away by their commitment to service and care for me and my individual needs.  It was all in my best interest and not theirs, which is more than anyone could hope for.  My family and I will continue business here to help them eventually reap the rewards of their exceptional service.  Thank you so much!

resp.text: Thanks so much!! Happy Holidays!!!

name: Thaddeus Scott
text: The best eye doctor around very professional and such a great staff also. Needed emergency care for eye injury was seen promptly and follow up was excellent as well. Will always recommend. Thanks for the exceptional care.

name: Chris Hatch
text: Very professional, hometown experience! Everyone puts you at ease and is very helpful and patient with the exam.  Frame selection is a blast! A much better choice than the big box impersonal places. Go see them, literally!

resp.text: Thank you so much Chris for your kind words! We are so glad that you had a good experience at our practice!!

name: Chad Parks
text: I have been a patient of Dr. Mansfield for several years and have always enjoyed and appreciated her manner. She’s thorough and professional while being personal and relatable. Her staff is always kind and helpful. My family followed Dr. Mansfield to her new practice and would follow her again. Thanks to the whole crew at Dr. Mansfield’s office! Y’all are the best.

resp.text: Our staff appreciates you, Chad! Thank you so much for your kind words.

name: Catherine Andrews
text: In the midst of COVID, this business maintains the personal feel that we all need right now.  I was safely registered, my temperature was taken with eyes that smile and, of course, a highly professional eye exam and glasses fitting. Well done & thank you for the many years of care you've given me.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your kind words, Catherine! We appreciate you.

name: Patricia Burcham
text: I love this facility and all of the people who work there.  I have been seeing Dr. Meyers for over 20 years and love her.  Now I see Dr. Mansfield and she is just as awesome.  I would never consider changing to another practice.  They are the best!

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind comments! It is patients like you who make our day!

name: Kai Smith
text: So Grateful to find an eye doctor who gets it right!  I have been so frustrated with wearing glasses and still not being able to see that I just stopped wearing them.  My contacts hurt my eyes so I gave up on them too.  Dr. Kye listed to my concerns and found the solution.  I <3 my new contacts.  I feel like a brand new person.  I will never take seeing clearly for granted!  Thank you again Dr. Kye

resp.text: Thank you, Kai!

name: DONALD GREEN
text: MY FIRST VISIT WITH DR.MANSFIELD AT HER NEW LOCATION. EVERYONE FROM MY SIGN IN TO HAVING MY EYES CHECKED OUT WAS SUPER FRIENDLY AND PROFESSIONAL. DR. MANSFIELD IS EXCELLENT. ALWAYS TREATS YOU AS A FRIEND AND GIVES A GREAT EXAMINATION OF YOUR EYES. HIGHLY RECOMMEND TO ANYONE SEEKING A NEW DOCTOR.

resp.text: Thank you, Donald! We appreciate you as a patient!

name: Mindy Weeks
text:
Office staff is very friendly and helpful when you walk in. Dr. Lewis is awesome! Answers any questions you may have. Would recommend
this place.

resp.text: We appreciate you, Mindy!

name: Buffie Holt
text: I originally had some issues but they were resolved. I love Dr. Mansfield & Meyer. I’m SO glad they were so helpful, and I got a really nice letter with my case they sent me.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words, Buffie! We appreciate you choosing us.

name: Randall Collum
text: Dr Mansfield an staff are the best ever. I'm hooked for life . The are great,I will follow here whenever she's an her staff at.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words, Randall!

name: Stacy Godfrey
text: Dr Jill Meyer is the absolute best! She takes her time with you and if very thorough. I have been a patient of hers for years. I am blessed to be a patient of hers!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review. We appreciate you choosing us!

name: Sharron Townson
text: Enjoyed my visit, good selection of glasses. Dr. Mansfield is very nice, and takes her time to make sure you get the right prescription.

resp.text: Thank you Sharron! It is one of our goals to bring you the best selection of eyewear!

name: Amanda Waldrup
text: Regular check up and got back right away; waited in car less than 5 minutes.  All went well and overall a good visit.

resp.text: Thanks so much for your review!  Happy Holidays!!!!

name: Trina Janay
text: Dr. Mansfield is the sweetest! So precise, caring, genuine, & thorough! Love her❤️

resp.text: Thank you, Jay! We appreciate you choosing us!

name: James Helton
text: Wonderful staff, friendly and helpful folks, answered every question, did not rush, and I will be back.

resp.text: Thank you James! We are happy to serve your eye care needs!

name: Rob Clifton
text: Best eye doctor I've ever been to.  Friendly staff, love the new location.

resp.text: Thank you, Rob! We appreciate your kind words!

name: Villette Rochford
text:
I've been seeing Dr. Mansfield for a few years now and definitely recommend her!  I have severe dry eyes and after seeing another Dr.when she was on vacation....2 weeks later I went right back to her.

She'll take the time to talk to you and in my case even do some research to provide a new medication for my condition.  Yes...Five stars to her and her new office!

resp.text: Thanks so much, Villette! We appreciate you!

name: mskayzee mskayzee
text: The staff at this office aim to please!!  Very helpful in getting contacts for me!! Thank you. Kaye Hendon.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words!

name: Linda Mims
text: This is one of the best around dr Mansfield is absolutely amazing and makes you feel right at home she will sit and talk with you she’s not an in and out doc she truly loves what she does I highly recommend her

resp.text: Thanks Linda! We appreciate you!

name: Robby
text: Had an appointment, email confirmation,  called to confirm day before and they say sorry we are booked and do not have you in the schedule. Really I have the email that says I am confirmed. Bad customer service..Should have called me. If I could give a negative star I would

resp.text: Rob, please accept our apology for the confusion. We will follow up with you directly to resolve this issue. Our patients' satisfaction is one our highest priorities.

name: Stan Shiparski
text: The best!! Thank you!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the positive review!!! Happy Holidays!!!

name: T O
text: The doctors and staff were so pleasant. They were nice,  friendly, caring,  and curteous. The doctor is funny too!!  Will definitely be back.

name: Nathan ciago
text: Was told over the phone for 110 dollors I could get an exam and glasses, I go in and they are determined to sell me a 40 dollor test or blind me for 3 days with tropicamide, then at the end of the exam the total was 115, was told 110,and did not include glasses was just an exam.after the fact no one would take the outside perscription, this doctor is a con artist little desk girls will say one thing and charge you another, I wouldn't have been able to get glasses for less then 400

name: Christy Pickering
text: Great experience! I have been to 5 different offices in the past week, looking for frames. Came here just to look but ended up purchasing because of the selection and staff. Kristin and Amber were extremely helpful and patient while I looked at almost every frame they had! They gave me honest feedback as to how the frames looked and made thoughtful suggestions based on my likes and preferences, but also encouraged me to try some I normally wouldn't have. I ended up choosing one I never would have picked up on my own!  Thank you again for the wonderful service!

name: Joyce Goodman
text: I called as a new patient having grey, blurry vision. I was seen two hours later as a work-in  patient. The doctor was thorough and caring. The staff was friendly and professional. I referred to an excellent opthalmologist who did laser surgery within a week. I have a return appointment to Southern Vision Care for a recheck of my eyes and a new pair of reading glasses. I have confidence in this practice's ability to care for my serious vision problems and to help me back into the world of clear vision.

name: David Carpenter
text:
Wow!
I spent a number of years in the eyecare profession and it takes a lot to impress me.  But Dr. Shirey and his highly attentive staff have won my personal medal of excellence.
Beyond making a personal connection, they treated me with kindness and welcomed me into their "work family."
The exam and other tests were state-of-the-art.  The doctor took time to explain the outcome to me thoroughly.  He even recommended a new type of contact lens that I was amazed that is working very well for me.
The bottom line is you get what you pay for.  Although SVC's price structure seems to be in line with other places, the  personal attention and knowledge you will benefit from here are beyond comparison.

name: Kristin Mullins
text: The nicest staff hands down and one of the most caring doctors I have been to. Highly recommend!

name: Shannon
text:
Positive: Doctor is very knowledgeable and I trusted him. Was very satisfied with the accuracy of the prescription and quality of the exam. Willing to answer questions.

Negative: This office is VERY uncooperative if you are wanting to order glasses online. The glasses that I got at the office were great but cost me $500. They did replace the lenses once because they were scratched. However, when I decided to order a pair of prescription sunglasses online (which I can get for just over $100) they made the process as difficult for me as possible. They seemed irritated with me for trying to get a better deal on glasses even though I was still coming to them for the exam. Then, they refused to give me my PD measurement with my prescription even though they had it on file and had taken the measurement for the first pair of glasses I ordered through them. Then, the woman I spoke with lied to me directly. She said that you have to have your PD measured each time you get glasses because it changes over time. False. I looked it up online and it is VERY rare that your PD will change once you are an adult who has gone through puberty. Very disappointed in their ability to function in modern times!

name: C M
text: I had a great experince. The ladies were so sweet and helped me pick out a pair of petite glasses that fit great! The doctor was incredible. He worked quickly but also listened to all of my concerns! Highly recommend!

name: Todd Seaborg
text: Absolutely fantastic service!  They got me in on a same day appointment and I received a very fast but thorough eye exam!  Great people, and a great experience!

name: Keith Bailey
text: Dr. Shirey at Southern Vision Care is the only optometrist I trust. The office staff are professional, courteous, and quick to assist patients/customers. A great experience every time. Highly recommended!

name: Mandi Sanders
text: Dr. Shirey's office is by the far the best eye care clinic I've been to. They have technology my retina specialist doesn't even have! And Dr. Shirey took the time to explain all my scan results (and show me the images) before fitting me for contacts. The front staff were very helpful and sweet. After trying several other places around town, this is where I will be going from now on.

name: S E
text: Today  is the last day that I go here. The two stars are strictly because the optometrist nice and very knowledgeable. The ladies at the front desk ALWAYS add up to $ 75 or higher of fees ( excluding co-pay) that is not cover up my insurance benefits. They pass it off has if is require or need but its not. It is very annoying. I have to constantly tell them that I do not want this added features if it not cover up my insurance provider. I contacted my insurance to ask about the fees that I was charged and they never even heard of them. It's almost has if they are making up fees for patients to pay out of pocket. Don't not go here unless your willing to pay at least $100 of out pocket even if they are you in-network provider.

name: Margaret Owens
text: Deciding to trust Southern Vision Care with my eyes has been the best medical decision I have ever made. The staff are warm, friendly, and caring, clearly following the example set by Dr. Shirey. I used to go to Sam's Club because it was close and the service was okay. However, several years ago Dr. Shirey was the doctor on duty. After experiencing his care I made the decision to go miles out of my way to Southern Vision Care. I have lived in New Jersey, Indiana, California, Georgia, and now Alabama. His office has the most modern equipment and the latest technology, and the absolute best staff I have ever experienced. As others have said, you will be doing your eyes and your spirits a favor by going to Southern Vision Care.

name: Markita Graham
text: The doctor was very friendly and nice me and my daughters love the staff! My girls were scared because it was their first visit but he made them feel comfortable...my eye doctor from now on

name: Vanessa Madere
text: Very knowledgeable staff and doctor. Great service.

name: Chrissy Marcus
text: Dr. Shirey and all of his staff were nice, professional and very helpful. I highly recommend Southern Vision Care.

name: Brian Orr
text: A great experience and advice. Thank you for being so streamlined!

name: Hobie Henning
text:
Nice doctor, but horrible staff. I decided to go to another eye doctor after the staff messing up my eye exam and then it taking multiple trips to get me in the right contacts. The staff was incredibly rude and short with me and was bad about not calling me back. I didn't like how pushy the tech was with me during my eye exam and angrily grabbing my eye-lid when I was having trouble keeping it open during the exam. I'm not a eye care specialist, but that felt very unprofessional grabbing somebody's eyelid in a dark room like that.

I've had glasses since second grade and contacts in high school and I never had this much trouble getting the right prescription or having staff treating me this rudely before. It just gave me a bad feeling about what would happen if I had an emergency and needed help. I just decided to take my business elsewhere.

name: charles cole
text: we are in are late 60s. and the doc is the best we have ever found. other doctors told my wife that she would never see good again boy were they wrong. Rebecca was a great  help everyone was helpful, including holding the door open, during the rain.  tks again chuck and rita  cole

name: Trey Bradley
text:
Today(06/2020): 1 Star
The staff, as always, were hospitable and polite. But, my opinion of Dr. Mark Shirey, who is also trying to run for public office - has changed.

Dr. Shirey was a savior to me when he helped me with a nearly debilitating ailment. I have photophobia - no I'm not scared of light. It's a diagnosis for high sensitivity to light. Bright light, and all Sun light, are very painful for me. Dr. Shirey gave me the prescription that helped me deal with this while driving, of which I can't describe how grateful I was for this. It was literally life changing.

But - during my last visit, Dr. Shirey told me that he "doesn't do that anymore". He doesn't recognize a diagnosis that's over 100 years old and recognized by all major medical institutions. His excuse was "ALDOT doesn't recognize it.", which is not true. Neither ALDOT or ALEA list any diagnosis that they do or don't recognize. The law in the state of Alabama is very clear in this regard.

When I got home, I did the research on this. I compiled the information and sent it to Dr. & Mrs. Shirey for review and follow-up. I haven't received anything back from them.

I've dealt with tremendous pain in my life, and live with severe musculoskeletal pain every day. Every day I deal with challenges doing things that most wouldn't have a second thought about. But the pain from bright light is something that stops me from being able to safely operate a vehicle. I have to close one eye and squint the other - all while they're watering. depending on how long I'm exposed, my vision just starts deteriorating - colors start blending/fading.. etc. It's not a pleasant experience when I'm without shaded lenses.

I've been very fortunate to have doctors and specialists that have helped me with a number of things in my life. Doctors that listen to their patients and seek to understand them.

This is the first time I've felt discriminated for a medical diagnosis. By a Doctor.

I'm sure Dr. Shirey didn't think of it like that, or do it out of spite. But it's still a blow to the quality of life for me. Dr. Shirey, like the rest of us, is human. But, in a position where you're responsible for providing care for and improving the quality of life for your patients, you should never assume, discount or interpret your patients plea as unimportant or conjecture.

I'm the one with the condition, not you. You're responsible for having the knowledge and authority to help me cope with the condition.

I do not take any pleasure in giving a review like this. Especially for a local owned business and a member of our community. But, I also take professional responsibility very seriously - and this was an irresponsible action that negatively affected my quality of life, where I was a patron seeking professional help to improve my quality of life. It was a request well within the realm of service that one would expect from this establishment.

This is very important as a leader in the community as well. If you want to run for office, don't start by discriminating against your own patients by directly denying them the help you're tasked with and responsible for providing.

I guess it's good practice for becoming a politician...

5 years ago: 5 Stars
I've visited this office twice and will be back. Both times I was promptly taken care of by the staff. Everyone there was polite and showed great hospitality. They have excellent equipment and are truly capable of providing great vision care.

Thanks! =)

name: Nicole Hurd
text: My experience at BarKing Optical far surpassed my highest expectations. Not only was the doctor personable, informative and pleasant to talk to; she was also extremely thorough and prides herself in educating her patients. Additionally, the staff was charming, courteous and cordial. What a great team they all are.  Based on my profession I’ve noticed that due to the pandemic some businesses now struggle with keeping up their customer service levels due to staffing shortages. But trust me, you won’t find that an issue here. If I could give the doctor and her team higher than 5-stars I would. And the office is quaint and cozy tucked away inside beautiful downtown Mobile, AL. It’s worth the drive no matter where you live along the Gulf Coast & I’m a tough critic!

name: Suely CM
text: Top notch service from Dr. King, Becky & Teresa. They’re really nice & take the time to make sure that you are happy with your new lenses. It’s always a pleasure to talk to Ms. Becky regarding any issues and she’ll always tell you to drop in should you need an adjustment to your glasses.

name: Dean Waite
text: Stop going to Walmart and other chain optometrists.  Support your local businesses.   Dr. King and her team- Becky and Teresa- are, hands down, the best in town.  Unbelievably friendly with top-notch service.  Dr. King is very thorough and takes the time to really provide an excellent eye exam.  They have state-of-the-art equipment and a very nice, welcoming office. Great sunglass selection too.   This should be the only optometrist you consider in town- wouldn’t go anywhere else!

name: Melody Bagwell
text: Excellent care. I have only needed glasses in the past few years. FINALLY, I have the correct prescription and i can see! It's great to be able to see again and pick up the crafts I love so much.

name: Terri Legg El-Farkh
text: Dr. King made my anxious daughter feel right at home. The office is cozy, there is a good selection of frames, and she and Mrs. Lyons took time with us to make sure everything went smoothly.  My daughter got a great pair of stylish glasses and can see clearly for the first time. Thanks so much!

name: Ron Marcelino
text: My daughter and I were at a convention in Mobile and my daughter forgot her contacts at home.  I called BarKing Optical to see if they could provide a trial pair of contacts.  Becky was kind enough to help out and gave us a trial pair.  Her generosity helped us out tremendously.  BarKing is AWESOME!

name: Mandy McDonald
text: We were on vacation at Dauphin Island when my eye became irritated and extremely painful.  I saw this place had good reviews so I called for an appointment. They advised me to bring quarters for the meter and told me where to park.  After the short drive they got me in immediately upon my arrival. Dr King did a thorough exam and explained that my eye was scratched.  She wrote a prescription for an antibiotic and gave me a free pair of shades to wear over my glasses for the rest of my vacation as my eye healed.  Extremely friendly and fast service. The office worker, Becky, gave me her cell number and offered to help with anything else I needed during our stay.  What an awesome experience!  Thank you!!

name: Peyton Lazzari
text: So happy with my experience at BarKing optical. I don’t like going to the eye doctor much, but the women on staff went above and beyond to make me comfortable after just sensing my hesitation on the phone. That level of care is unmatched. I’ve never had such a pleasant experience at a doctor’s office in my life. Looking forward to going back!!

I have taken my children, husband, and mother-in-law to E.O.A. with no regrets, ever, as everything is always sanitary, professional, friendly, and spot on correct. They do not stop until they have given you the correct solutions for your eyes. Thank you, E.O.A.! I'm one happy camper with my eyes in their care.

The contact lens assessment included all the follow up visits and trial lenses I need for 3 months! The staff is still friends as always.

resp.text: Thank you so much! It was a pleasure to meet you!

text: Dr. Branch is truly amazing! She found an issue with my son, raised it to my attention and followed up with me several times to check on him personally! She is truly a caring doctor with a huge heart!

name: Patricia Fethke
text:
The doctor and staff were great. Very courteous and professional. However, I would not recommend purchasing glasses from this facility unless you want to pay a pretty substantial price and wait for quite some time to receive them. Two weeks ago, I had an exam and ordered 2 pairs of glasses that cost me over $1100 and I am still waiting to receive them. I was told at the time of the order that they would be there in a week, at most a week and a half. I've called to check on the status and was told that they come in 10-14 business days. So, I have been told 2 different time frames and as of yet, neither have been accurate.
UPDATE: Shortly, as in less than 20 minutes, after posting my review, I received a call that my glasses were ready to be picked up. This call included an apology because my glasses had come in more than a week ago and they claimed to have been calling an incorrect phone number. The issue I have with that explanation is that my glasses arrived on March 28th. I called to check the status on March 29th and was told that it would be another week. I cannot think of any acceptable excuse for that. The customer service that I received after they had received my payment was far from what a person would expect. I will not return for any additional services or products.

name: Kristina Romine
text: Excellent doctor and staff. Everyone was so knowledgeable and friendly.

name: Melissa Lambert
text: Great doctors and friendly staff everyone was helpful!

name: Ryan Smith
text:
This is a great optometry practice.  Dr. Hoerth and staff are very knowledgable and offer excellent customer service.  I would highly recommend this optometry office.  Much better experience than some "big box" optical stores I have been to.

- R. Smith

text: My Grand daughter has been treated with much care and professionalism.

name: phillip thrasher
text: This place is a rip off my dad took his glasses there and they kept them for sometime we went back up there to pick his glasses up and they were wrong he took them back up there and again they kept them from sometime and again they were wrong so he took them to Walmart and after spending some money they was able to fix them so no this place is no good and will definitely not be going back

resp.text: Although we strive for 100% patient satisfaction some times we fall short.  Unfortunately in this situation, when we use another doctor’s prescription, all we can do is make it to their specifications. We were also limited with what frames and lenses we could offer due to the insurance plan being used. If this would have been a patient of ours or prescription from Dr. Hoerth or Dr. Branch there would have been more flexibility in the adjustments to be made. Without having an examination at our office, we cannot provide a prescription or make changes to another doctor's prescription. We realize this doesn’t make up for falling short in your expectations, but we will continue to work hard and learn from this, so we can continue toward 100% patient satisfaction!

text: I saw Dr. Chambers and have to say it was the fastest eye exam I have ever experienced.  She was in a hurry from the second she entered the exam room.  I was taken aback at her abrupt dismissal of me when I had questions.  As I continued the process of choosing frames, etc. I observed how the patients were being pushed through quickly.  I don't think this type of office is for me.

text: I came in for an exam this morning and had a wonderful experience. Dr Chambers was helpful and informative and Jason found a great pair of glasses for me. couldnt be happier.

text: I've lived in a few different cities and been through several different optometrists. These guys run a tight ship. They are professional and friendly. I am waiting on a response from corporate on this matter.

name: K-Diva Licious
text: I absolutely love the staff they were all nice and friendly. The doctor is by far the best eye doctor that I have had. She is very thorough and informative. I always enjoy my appointment when I go there it's like seeing old friends.

name: Susan Johnson
text: My grandson’s glasses were broken so we went here to have them replaced or repaired. Gene was able to do a quick, temporary fix; also, gave us a coupon to use to purchase new glasses. We are always pleased when we go here. Dr. Vanoy always takes good care of my family! I highly recommend this location!

name: Tara Orie
text: Rip-off, you can get higher quality services at much cheaper prices out there. In short, my contact prescription was incorrect and my glasses prescription was incorrect; both of which resulted in my glasses being unusable as well as half of the contacts I purchased. In total I paid over $800 for all services and glasses/contacts. And now over a year later, I'm receiving calls from a debt collector claiming that I still owe another $100. Go somewhere else.

resp.text: Tara, I'm Cassie. I'm so sorry to hear about your experience in our office! I'd like to look into what happened. Could you please email me at cassiegoodwin@eyecare-partners.com when you have a moment? Again, I'm very sorry about this. I hope to hear from you soon.

text: I love this place and the staff! Everyone is very friendly and helpful. I’ve never had a bad experience.

text: It’s funny how I ended up with my appointment. They sent a text to someone else to verify their appointment. I said , they had the wrong number but I needed an appointment. So they set me one. I have never found a sweeter more knowledgeable staff. Looking forward to getting my new glasses. Thanks again girls for a job very well done.

name: Vanessa Cartet
text: Thanks So Very much for An Awesome Experience!

name: Paulette Boston
text:
I had an appointment with eyecare associates about  a month ago.
the optometrist that did my eye exam was very good I was very pleased.
the night mare began once I sat at the desk to choose my glasses.
the associate reviewed the order due to the fact that she was the expert on eyewear. I ended up with additional  things I did not really need on my
glasses. I got them home and could not see my work computer, everything was blurry even reading. I called and informed them that
the glasses was not working,, the optometrist rechecked my eyes and
the prescription it was good. I informed them it was the coating on the
glasses all that extra that had been added. they did an minor adjustment
I still could not see my computer it was still blurry. I  went back a third time and insisted that they remove all those coating-Ultimate Poly-Carb
Addon*Ultimate Poly*Anti-Reflective Premium*UV400, This was close to
ridiculous that I had to spend time running back and forth for a pair of
new glasses that I could not use. After those coatings were removed
I can see my work computer better but they are not better than my old
glasses. I was so frustrated and disappointed  not only to have to go back today to have the associate to remove the black pen mark they left on my
glasses when they were trying to make the corrections. I have never had this much trouble getting a new pair of glasses. This was not the type
of service that I was expecting, It was as if they could not seem to get
my glasses right.

resp.text: Paulette, I'm Cassie. I'm glad you enjoyed the optometrist at your visit, and I'm so sorry about all these issues with your glasses! I'd like to look into how this happened. When you have a moment, could you please email me at cassiegoodwin@eyecare-partners.com? Again, I'm very sorry about this. I hope to hear from you soon.

text: The woman who did my exam was wonderful. I do wish there were more frame options. I had a hard time finding a pair I liked. I then had to ask multiple times for my prescription and PD to attempt to look for a pair online. They refused to give a PD unless I bought from them. I was under the impression that it was a part of the exam I paid for. I would've paid a fee for the convenience had that been an option. I ended up going across the street to another chain and they gave me those measurements for free. I was so happy with their service and frame options that I didn't even end up buying online, I bought 2 pairs from them. That little extra courtesy could've been a sale for them. I likely won't go back due to those circumstances. Again, the actual optician was wonderful. They just need more selection and they wouldn't have to worry about losing sales to other chains and online vendors.

She went above and beyond what she had to. We have always been treated great at Bradley by everyone. Thank you Sara!

name: Tiana Richardson
text: I have been going here since I was 19 and wearing contacts for the first time.Dr.Bradley and his team are among the most professional in the business.I absolutely love the service from Dr.Bradley himself and and the wonderful ladies that greet you at the front desk.Love this crew!

name: Connor Fortney
text:
SCAM! DO NOT GO HERE! Can’t leave a zero so a 1 will have to do it. Left with $144 bill which should’ve been a $20 co-pay plus my retina imaging.

I get an eye exam every single year and have never had a practice claim my visit under “medical”. I have no existing or pre-existing conditions. Sounds like this is a known issue at this place. Warning to all, they will say your visit isn’t routine and they won’t take your vision insurance and claim it under medical. Save your time and money and go somewhere else! Put some drops in your eyes before you go in, they may say you have dry eyes and claim it under medical.

name: Daryl Jackson
text: This was a great experience and great facility. Very kind staff. Very knowledgeable doctor. Definitely a good place to come. Been wearing glasses my whole life nd this was honestly the most pleasant exam I've ever had. It was quick too.

name: Dylan Jones
text:
The staff are very friendly and helpful. I was very impressed by the customer service.
I had an eye injury on a Friday night. The next day I was turned down by 3 different offices in Foley and Fairhope. This place took care of me and I’m very grateful for everyone, especially the doctor. She was very friendly and knowledgeable!
Thank you Sarah, Tabitha, and Dr. Davis!

name: Teresa Kiel
text: Dr. Bradley & associates are AMAZING!  Very thorough. Explains everything. Highly recommend

name: Derek Watson
text:
A owner who feels the need to attack everyone that writes negative reviews. Violates HIPPA laws flagrantly. Why Lenscrafters continues to conduct business with someone that takes advantage of the customer, the insurance provider and probably the government astonishes me.

Let's wait and see how a RESPECTABLE company responds to another negative comment from a customer who felt taking advantage and who's insurance company agreed with the customer.

My insurance company resided the payment the originally made because of the SCAM the company run and paid them for a simple office visit.

..........

Update:

The Office of Civil Rights sided with me and is going to give Bradley Eye Care technical advice being their first offense reported to them. Other actions can be taken if the Office of Civil Rights receives future complaints.

At least the person posting for this company hopefully learns a lesson.

name: Derek Watson
text:
Because I'm not able to give zero, I will give 1 twice.
Be aware of the SCAMS this company runs before doing business with them. They will try and take advantage of you.
.......
You're doing a fine job without any help.
How goes that legal action against a social media review?
While it has been ruled that reviewing business on social media cannot be used as a form of defamation, discussing someone's case being turned over to collections most definitely is. I hope he reads this and follows up with it.
And discussing office visits of your patients violates HIPPA codes which I have already moved to have that investigated. Others who had any of their eye visits discussed on social media should also contact The Office of Civil Rights. This company has taken advantage of, mocked, ridiculed, embarrassed there patients and most importantly broken laws.
.....
Anyone choosing to use this company, please keep this all in mind and ask questions the entire office visit!

resp.text: This review is flagged as malicious since this person has already left a negative review. He is trying to ruin my business and I will be seeking legal action to block him.

name: Natalie Bayne
text: I showed up without an appointment, and they were able to fit me in very easily. They helped me get the right contacts I needed. They are very nice with customer service. I asked to go a bit slower, so I could understand everything and they complied very happily. I am extremely pleased with my experience.

resp.text: We are set up to take walk-ins and same day appointments. Patients can't wait 2 or 3 weeks for an appointment when they have broken their glasses or have an eye infection. Thanks for your excellent review!

name: Derek Watson
text:
Bradley Eye Care is a scam artist! When you schedule an appointment they tell you if it turns into a medical visit your insurance will not cover it. They preform the same eye exam Walmart on I65 does for $88 with no insurance.  At no point during the visit do they inform the patient they are changing the visit to a medical visit. Only when you are done do you find out that your visit was changed to medical and your insurance doesn't cover that. As I said, SCAM ARTIST. I'm surprised Lenscrafters allows such a company to do business inside thier doors and under thier banner. Myself, I contacted my insurance immediately and informed them of the scam so they can appeal the charges. Hopefully others will read the reviews of this place before becoming the next victim.
....
Actually my statements were all true. I was never told my appointment was turning into a medical exam. Yes I signed a piece of paper that said "IF" but was never made aware of that it had. No other eye doctor has ever tried pulling this SCAM on me.

You're right. You do not deserve one star. If it was possible to give zero I would have.

Aetna did payed them what they billed, which I did appeal and the did APPROVE the appeal. I have a copy of the appeal and my monthly Aetna statement. Aetna paid them for a standard eye exam for which I went in for.

I paid ZERO because I have a zero copay on standard eye exams.

Someone who think they need to argue with and lie about their customers speaks volumes about your business.

I HOPE OTHERS READ THIS POST BEFORE BEING TOOK ADVANTAGE OF BY THESE SCAM ARTIST AND IF YOU ARE TAKING ADVANTAGE OF BY THEM, CONTACT YOUR INSURANCE COMPANY. YOUR INSURANCE COMPANY IS MORE THAN WILLING TO LISTEN AND LOOK INTO THESE COMPANIES!

ALSO YOUR STATEMENTS BREACHES HIPPA LAWS AND I WILL BE MAKING A COMPLAINT ON THAT ALSO!

Also, I did screenshot.

Anyone who has had any medical information shared by this company, no matter how informal it was. Share to the Office of Civil Rights. They are looking into this company.

resp.text: I am sorry you had a bad experience at Bradley Eye Care, but we are certainly not scam artists.  Most of your statements are just not true.  You knew you were going to require a medical eye examination because of a disease you have , the medications you take and your medical ocular complaints.  I have a form signed by you that clearly states ..."if a medical diagnosis is found during your exam, your routine vision insurance will not cover the visit". You have a systemic disease that is definitely affecting your vision and is known to be the leading cause of blindness in your age group.  Your Aetna insurance that you appealed to did not see any "scam" and correctly paid the claim.  How can you claim we are scam artists and give us a one star review when your total out of pocket cost that day was ZERO?  You have not paid us one cent and received an excellent in-depth vision exam.

name: Susan Willcox
text: Excellent office staff and very thorough eye doc.   He educates the patients.      Everyone in this office is professional and Kind!!  You cannot ask for anything more!!!

resp.text: Thank you for your excellent review. We strive to take care of our patients and discuss their eye conditions we diagnose in detail. Looking forward to seeing you again!

name: Terri Mathis
text: Sarah, the wife of Dr Bradley is his office manager. She charged my card for over a hundred dollars more than I gave her permission for. In this day of paying Bill's via our credit card, I assumed I could trust her. I had to go to bank security and dispute the charge, thank goodness it was on a recorded line. Due to the dishonesty and possible future theft to others, I can not recommend Bradley Eye acare.

resp.text: I am sorry I am so late responding to your review. I am trying to update my Google business account and they pointed out that I had never responded to your review. I asked Google to delete your review due to conflict of interest. You were an employee at a competing Lenscrafters in 2018. You left out some important details in your review. Your exam was in January and you paid zero. Sara called you repeatedly for payment and your account was finally settled in October with your credit card. You disagreed with paying off your account and initiated a charge back with your credit card company. We responded to your claim and your credit card company sided with us. We do not extend credit and expect payment at the time of service.

name: Khatira ali
text: The most friendly and fun staffs. Sarah and Diana were awesome. I been there two days in a row for my parents appointment and my brother in law appointment. They made the experience great! :)

name: Stephen Wilkerson
text: I had an amazing experience here this weekend and want to share with everyone. It was last weekend of year so obviously they were busy with folks needing to use end of year benefits. I already wear RX glasses but apparently used an incorrect cleaner and ruined my lenses. I called to see if they could help me and Sara fit me right in. She was so friendly and professional and helped me with insurance claim at the end. And Dr Bradley has some crazy high tech equipment which allowed him to do a thorough eye exam with the need for the dreadful pupil dialation. He tweaked my current RX slightly and I can’t wait to get my new lenses. I was treated like a long time customer and I will always use this office going forward. And I wish I remembered the name of the young woman that did my initial eye exam because she was also amazing. Thank you Dr Bradley and team!!!

name: John Doss
text: I had an eye exam which went great. I switched from glasses to contacts the ones where one eye is close up and the other is distance,  it sounds strange but they are very easy and natural,  no having to get used to them like with glasses. I sent my wife to him too,  she  has some serious eye problems,  Dr Bradley is very knowledgeable and honest. He was the only one of three places my wife went to who was honest enough to tell her glasses wouldn't do her any good and didn't try to sell her something that wouldn't work. He was the only one who even knew about her condition. Highly recommend them.

name: Trenika Johnson
text: Great Experience!!!  I had a 3:30 appointment time. I signed in around 3:25 and was out by 4:20.  Staff was friendly and professional. Dr. Davis took her time and addressed all of my concerns. Highly recommend this office.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words.  We are happy that you enjoyed your experience at Bradley Eye Care.

name: Janet Williams
text: Arrived on time. Checked in. After 25 minutes past my appointment I asked how much longer it would be. Was told at least another 30 minutes. No apology. No call in advance to let me know of the one hour delay. I could not wait so I left. Very disappointing and disrespectful of clients' time.

resp.text: The patient did have a 2:00 appointment in my office yesterday. She had paperwork to fill out for a few minutes and walked out at exactly 2:23 pm complaining about the "long wait". We strive to keep on schedule as best we can. But with any doctor's office, there are patients that take more time and unforseen emergencies. Delays happen and we always apologize to our patients. In this case there was no apology because we were not behind. A 23 minute wait is not unreasonable. Just because this person has no patience, she is allowed to say what she wants and leave my practice a poor review.  Please give my business the benefit of the doubt here. We accept most insurance plans and we are the only EyeCare practice in Mobile open 7 days a week.

name: Cody Moorer
text: Awesome experience. It was my first ever eye exam and I didn't know what to expect. It was quick painless and I can see. Will definitely be back.

name: Joshua Kautz
text:
Just. The. Worst.

I recently got my yearly Eye Exam at Bradley. During the exam, Dr. Davis asked me what kind of contacts I had been wearing because I wrote down something other than she had prescribed. She said, "Whoever you got your contacts had better have given you Alcon, or I'll have their license. It's illegal for someone to prescribe anything other than I have prescribed to you."

During checkout, my PayFlex card was declined and I didn't have any other method of payment. So I asked the girl at the front desk if there was anything else we could do. She said, "Oh, we'll call you on Monday and make sure we get our payment, or we'll send you a bill." I understood that I was unable to get a prescription, but they refused to give me a trial pair of contacts or anything because my bill was not satisfied.

Eventually, I had to call my wife's cousin, who let me pay for it over the phone with her credit card. After paying, I asked again for a trial pair of contacts and they told me that I had been finalized and could not give me a trial pair, as they had a limited supply and those were for "patients who had to come back." She acquiesced and said she would ask the doctor if she could give me a pair.

After FORTY-FIVE minutes, she apologized for the wait and told me that she was able to give me a pair of trial contacts, but the right eye was not the correct prescription. I put the contacts in and, needless to say I will NOT be back.

UPDATE: Changed review to 5 stars. Not because of anything that they did, but because Dr. Bradley got his feelings hurt. I'm not sure how he wants to run his business, but EVERYONE, please check your medical records. He let me know, after 4 years, that I still had a balance with his company. He called me a fraud because he said I presented an invalid and expired insurance card. Supposedly he will contact an insurance company that I haven't had insurance with in 4 years to try to recoup $99 for his business. I hope he's successful, but I will never use him, or recommend him for anyone else. I'm not sure why he feels the necessity to fight with people, but here's 5 stars for him so his google ad campaign is successful.

resp.text: I am sorry I am so late in responding to your review. I am trying to update my Google business account and they pointed out that I had never responded to your review. I apologise that you had an unhappy experience at Bradley EyeCare. The vast majority of our patients appreciate our excellent hours, our high tech equipment, and our excellent staff and doctors. We provide free trial lenses as needed as a courtesy to patients who purchase their lenses here. You have never purchased lenses from us. Dr. Davis gave you a copy of your contact lens prescription the day if the exam. You also left out a very important fact in your review. The insurance card you presented was later found to be terminated leaving you with a very large balance. You have since been turned over for collection.

name: Stephen Feng
text: Friendly service. Walked in and needed an emergency eye exam because i lost my glasses while on vacation. Super nice and easy to deal with!

resp.text: We are glad we were able to take care of your eye emergency and get you back home safely. We have the best hours of any eye care provider in Mobile. We are open 7 days a week, including Sunday afternoons. Thanks for the 5 star review!

Problem was resolved. Great job by the office manager.

text: Dr. Essinger is the best doctor and the staff were very friendly and respectful. I recommend Dr. Essinger to everyone that is looking for kind and caring eye doctor.

text: I have loved my experiences at Vestavia Eye Care. The staff are all incredibly kind and knowledgeable while still at the same time efficient and fast! It feels like the staff truly care about me and my eyes, I will never go to any other eye doctor in Alabama!

text: I am actually at the office waiting to see Dr. E, and I am listening to someone who works here call other optometrists’ offices in a city across the country because one of their patients forgot her contact lenses while on vacation, and they are calling offices in this city to find their patient some contact lenses. THIS is going above and beyond, and this is why I love them. Everyone is so nice here, and you will receive excellent care.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words!

name: Tom Bradley
text:
l wanted to thank Dr. Essinger and the entire staff for the personal attention provided during my recent eye examination and purchase of new glasses and sunglasses. I moved from my previous optometrist due to their poor service and what seemed to be lack of caring. Their prescription was wrong and I lived with it for a year. Both the new glasses and sunglasses came out fantastic. I can see so much clearer.

Please keep up the great work and I am so glad I found my way to your office.

Tom Bradley

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words!  It is our pleasure to serve you!

name: Matt Speer
text: Very friendly and helpful

resp.text: Thank you!

name: dkniven1
text: Very professional BUT also personable. Dr Essinger went out of his way to assist me and I could not have been more impressed. This place knows how to take care of their patients. Thank you.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words!  It is our pleasure to serve you!

name: Allie Taylor
text: I chose to schedule an eye exam here at random, as it happened to be the closest to my work. Great choice, as I feel like It was the best eye exam I’ve ever had! Dr. Essinger was personable and extremely knowledgeable. He took the time to show me my retinal scan (which was super cool) and explain exactly what I was seeing and how it related to my vision. He also recommended a supplement to improve my macular pigment, and gave me an extra pair of contacts so I could try out a new brand that just came out. Way better experience than going to a chain like Target or LensCrafters as I have in the past. Other employees were also great, even though I think I was keeping them from their lunch break. Highly recommend coming here!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words!  It is our pleasure to serve you!

name: Donna K. Fitch
text: These are the most caring doctors I've been to. They are unfailingly pleasant, courteous, efficient and knowledgeable. Usually I see Dr. Fisk, who is wonderful, but recently I had a problem with my eyes and was assisted by Drs. Essinger and Ray. So now I know for sure that everyone is great. And the staff and friendly and very helpful. I highly recommend this practice!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words!

name: Jon Carter
text: Since I had iLasic surgery i had experienced a slight issue with my vision post op. More recently I have felt my eyes straining over 2 years after the procedure. After seeing the reviews here on google I made an appointment. I was NOT disappointed! I had a wonderful interaction with the staff. Even while suffering a network problem with their systems they were able to do my workup without a hitch. Dr. Essinger took the time to understand my vision concerns and provided me with an exam that identified that i only have a minor need for correction. The options and advice provided were exactly what I needed to know and I would gladly direct friends and family to come to Vestavia Eye Care for their needs.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words!  It is our pleasure to serve you!

name: Victoria Melton
text: Vestavia Eye Care is the best place to get your eye exam and glasses. Dr. Essinger is very very knowledgeable and VERY patient and kind, and he was able to help me when other eye doctors were not. Dorinda is great at fitting glasses, and the rest of the staff is great too. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED, 5 star, A++++!!!!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words!

name: Tawanna Rankin
text: The staff were friendly as soon as I walked through the door. The doctors made my son very comfortable they talked and laughed with him through his whole examination. I would recommend to anyone.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind words!

name: Dave Lewis
text: Dr Day is a great optometrist! He even referred me to the ophthalmologist who did my trifocal lens replacement surgery (souped-up cataract surgery). For me the healing time was very quick and I came out of the procedure already able to see. Now, three months after surgery, I see better than I can remember ever seeing before (my vision is now 20/20). Before surgery my eyes were so bad (about -11) that I was not a candidate for anything but the trifocal lens replacement but I saw it as an investment in my future health as I was getting worried about night driving. So glad I did it!

name: Don Johnson
text: Dr Day is my expert for all things vision. I learn so much every time I go into his office. He handles he vision for all the staff at Freedom Heating and Cooling and everyone loves it.

name: Kathlene Rushing
text: I drove from Pensacola, Florida to see Dr. Day because I can't find anyone like him in Pensacola. Great Doctor!

name: Andrew Miller
text: Got a pair of glasses here couple months ago same day!! These guys really knows the value of customer service. I’ll be sure to recommend any of my family or friends. Thanks Dr. Day, you gave me my eyes back lol

text: The Staff and Doctor are great.  Got glasses while I waited.  They have a sincere care not only for your eye health,  but also your entire well being.  It's worth the drive from Gadsden.  Would recommend to anyone.

name: Andrew Rózsa
text: Dr. Jim Day is a consummate professional. His family has been in Optometry for 3 generations and they carry on an impeccable reputation. Dr. Day keeps up to date with the latest news in optometry, has a deep commitment to our community and for nearly 35 years has provided us with personal and caring service. His friendly and homey clinic puts you to ease immediately as you enter the waiting room. The staff is always ready to help and accommodate (sic!) your needs. I have been using Dr. Day for 30 years and wouldn't think of ever using anybody else's optometry services.

As a physician, I can whole-heartedly recommend him for your ongoing care of all of your vision needs. Moreover, if there is a condition where you need more extensive care, he is well regarded in the tertiary centers and his referrals are given expert care.

He also has a huge selection of trendy frames to choose from.  The staff is also always very friendly and helpful.  As long as I live in Tuscaloosa, I'll never go anywhere else.

I recommend anyone to use their service please try them they are some nice people.

Terry and I have been seeing Dr Moore for several years, as well as most of my siblings,(5) and he saw my mama before she passed on to Glory Land!! He and the entire staff are AWESOME! Recently I acquired a vitreous detachment in my left eye. WOW they were on top of things getting me in asap!!
Dr. Moore and the staff made it very clear to me how important it was if ANYTHING changed suddenly with my sight. I had some issues and yep they got me right in again on short notice.  He loves his patients and treats them like family as far as I am concerned.  Very professional place. Why he even took to Destiny on his birthday a few years back!!! Need a eye doctor?? Don't you dare go anywhere else!! Sorta like the Kabota Tractor commercials"don't you buy no ugly tractor"-well "DON'T YOU GO NO WHERE ELSE TO GET YO EYES CHECKED"!!!!

text:
Dr. Moore has been my eye Dr for 20 years!
I think I was 13 the first time we used him. I moved away for a couple years when my husband was in the Military... I saw a military ever Dr one time and it just wasn't the same, after that I made sure to schedule appoints with MY eye Dr when I knew I would be home for a visit. My husband, and kids, brother and many friends use him also, and we all love him and the staff! They are always helpful, and informative, and though they take their time, they are really quick and efficient in a way that never makes me feel rushed. One of my favorite things is that I've never ever had to wait longer than 10 minutes for scheduled appointments. Even when they "worked my son in", we didn't wait longer than 10 - 15 minutes. Highly recommended!

name: Jaimie Howard
text: After referencing my insurance coverage, I was made aware that Moore Eye Clinic was within my network. Last year, I visited Moore Eye Clinic for the first time to get new eyeglasses. Bea, an office staff member, worked with me for almost two hours to find the right pair. She also explained all of the possible upgrades on the eyeglasses with pricing. A year later, I am still happy with the pair that I chose and the experience that I had. I was recently due for a contact eye exam. Because I had a good experience previously, I chose to return to the office for this procedure. The entire office is clean, bright and friendly. I was brought to the back almost immediately for my exam. The office had both standardized and progressive eye exam tools of technology. The office staff member who had worked with me explained all price upgrades for the exams on each of the machines that was not included. Dr. Moore was professional, informative and thorough. He was patient throughout the exam and took time to explain my current eye health and prescription. He also went above and beyond to explain the contact brand options that would work well with my eyes. After the exam, I was told that Dr. Moore preferred me using trials of the new prescription prior to ordering. I appreciated this long-term because it ensured that I felt comfortable in my new lenses. Since getting to know this office, I will not go anywhere else in Tuscaloosa. I have recommended Moore Eye Clinic to co-workers and friends within this area.

resp.text: We are so glad Bea was able to help you find the perfect pair of glasses! Thank you for taking the time to recommend us!

name: Sylvia B
text: This was my first time and I loved it! They were so nice, I didn't have to wait long at all, and they were really helpful!

Top-notch, A+ service!

text: I scratched my eye and was in a lot of pain.  The office staff was caring, concerned, and made sure to get me taken care of quickly.  They worked me into the schedule the same day and I was very grateful for that speed and attention.  My eye is now healed and I have found a great new eye doctor.

text: I was thoroughly impressed!  I woke up with my eye almost swollen shut, and called some other offices trying to get in on a Friday, then I tried this office, they were extremely courteous and offered to work me in later that morning.  When I arrived the girl was helpful getting my insurance cards sent from my mom.  The Doctor seemed very nice and very thorough.  I will be returning after this problem is all cleared up to get new contacts.  I would highly recommend Davis Eye Clinic

name: Dawn Bryant
text: I have used Davis eye clinic for years.   I wouldn't go or take my children anywhere else.  Anytime we've ever had any issues we have been seen promptly and issue addressed.   The staff took a huge amount of time teaching my son how to put in and take out his contacts. Dr bedsole is always professional and efficient.

name: Clay Davis
text: Davis Eye Clinic is one of those rare doctor's offices who actually reads your family medical history and noticed that glaucoma runs in my family and thus, has kept a close watch on my eye pressure ratings at each checkup and has kept me informed of any abnormalities.  Additionally, the staff are friendly and knowledgeable.

name: Sharon Smith
text:
If you can find a more professional, caring and knowledgable optometrist than Dr Stephanie Bedsole, my advice would be to use them.  Having been born with extremely poor vision, I have been seeing eye doctors since the age of 6 so I have seen MANY eye care professionals in my lifetime.  Dr. Bedsole is the consummate eye care professional and I am so thankful she is in Tuscaloosa.

Over the past 12 years she has treated my husband and me for regular exams as well as an unfortunate case of pink eye, severe dry eye,  identification of cataract,  loss of vision field, and diagnosis of under the eyelid infection.  This is in addition to the normal aging exams for the use of reading glasses, changes in prescriptions, etc.

I cannot say enough good things about Dr Bedsole as an optometrist and as a caring individual.  She follows up on her patients to make sure they are improving.  She has even accepted an off hours message from me when we had an eye related emergency and responded immediately. As I stated earlier, if you can find a better one - use them.  My bet is that there is not a better eye care professional in Tuscaloosa than Dr Bedsole.

name: Katelyn Mccary
text: Terrible, rude staff. The doctor fit me for new contacts despite me insisting that I had just been given an updated prescription by my eye doctor at home a few months prior. I also emphasized that I had 3 months' supply of contacts at home and was NOT looking to buy new ones. The doctor told me that was fine and that she would just write me a new prescription in case I wanted to update my lenses. This was after her asking me what my old prescription was and me telling her what I THOUGHT it was, emphasizing that I was pretty sure the prescription I had at home was much stronger than the numbers I could remember. Please keep in mind that I am young and inexperienced in the medical field and basically just moved through my appointment (which was supposed to only be a check-up on the blood vessels in my eyes) basically nodding along to whatever the doctor and the staff said because I know NOTHING about this stuff. When I get up to the front counter to pay they informed me that I owed $100 for the contact fitting that I DID NOT ASK FOR and that even the doctor explained to me wasn't entirely necessary because she told me I could one day use the updated prescription she wrote me if I wanted to. Ended up going home, letting my dad call them (because they would not listen to me at check out) and ultimately making my way back to the office for a refund of the $100. The entire time I'm there for the refund, an older lady who was not in any sort of medical attire (she looked like a patient) harassed me telling me I was not fit to drive with my old prescription, she could get me in trouble, etc. She stood over me badgering me while I removed the contacts that the doctor sent me home with and returned the prescription the doctor wrote me to her. The way I was treated by the staff here was absolutely ridiculous. Do not go here. Do not refer anymore UA students here. Btw, when I got home the prescription I had been written three months ago was the exact same as the one the doctor here wrote me. Go figure.

name: Billy and Megan Cox
text: I was here about three years ago amd I will never return. Mr.Dr.McCurdy was very respectful and a very good doctor. My experience with Mrs.Dr.McCurdy, on the other hand was a nightmare. I came in with an eye ulcer and Mr.Dr.McCirdy helped me a lot and asked for a second follow up visit to see how my eye was feeling. When I returned I did not seem him. I saw his wife who works along side him. I was ok with this until she figured out I was a victim of a rare disease. When this became apparent to her, she began pestering me with questions. It ended with her asking "If you would mind me taking a couple pictures of your eyes?" I was reluctant but agreed. Instead of using the provided equipment to take professional pictures, she instead took the machine with a light and mirrors and instead of putting her eye to it, she took two pictures with her iPhone 7. I remember it being an iPhone 7 because it stated that it was on the bill right next to the 75$ price tag of each picture she took. After this I did not want to return for my yearly eye exam but I agreed to with the condition I would Mr.Dr.McCurdy instead of Mrs. So when we made the appointment we made it VERY clear we wanted him, not her. Well wouldn't you know it, who do I see when I walk in the door of the doctor's office. She was happily smiling with one of her nurses there. I sat in the chair waiting for the exam to begin. Instead of doing that, she asks the nurse to sit there and stare at my deformed eyes. After a couple minutes, I spoke up and asked if we could start the exam. She agreed and proceeded to put dilating drops in my eyes. When she got down to look she asked if I still had my contacts in. I said yes. She immediately pulls each of them out of my eye and throws them in the trash before I can react. I tell her those were my last contacts and she pulls them out of the trash and puts them in solution. Well we go on with exam even though I should've left right there. We finish and without asking me anything, she reaches to get the contacts and starts to try to put them in my eye. I ask her what she's doing and I explain to her I don't want contacts from the trash. She tries setting me up with a pair of sample contacts, which weren't even fit to my prescription, the equivalent of me putting on reading glasses when I'm legally blind without proper aid. She tells me we'd laugh this off and I left as quickly as possible. It's been three years or so, Mrs.McCurdy. When do I start laughing?
