name: Terry M. Slaton
text:
I have been a patient of Dr. Nichols for several years now and he and his office provides personal and full service care for my eyes.  I have had occasions when an eye injury occurred, something diagnosed as a "detached viscous" which happened first in one eye then, a year later, in the other.  Dr. Nichols explained the first time that it occurred, how important it was to make sure that the condition was watched carefully for the first several weeks or so, until the detachment was complete as it could result in a detachment of the retina during the process.  He told me to call 24 x 7 if I had any issues and that he or one of the other doctors in the office would see me immediately.  This is the kind of service that is unexpected today but shows the care and concern that Dr. Nichols and his office provides.  If you want really good care for your eyes, and thorough examinations, I highly recommend the practice.

TS

name: Tim Graham
text: Eye care is great. Office staff not so much. Instead of giving me the promised $50 discount for buying contacts and glasses at the same time, they added an additional $50 instead.They did have new computers when I was there so I understood that they were having difficulties with the system. Also charged me another $58.60 charge that could not be explained.  I went back to their office and explained what happened, showed them their own paperwork showing this, and they promised to correct it but did nothing. I had to contact my credit card to have these charges put on hold. The credit card company took off the $50 overcharge and the additional $58.60 charge that was never explained; however I never received the $50 discount that I was promised. After a second office visit and several phone calls they still did nothing. Not a good way to do business. Dr. Bedsole is good but his office staff is not. If you use him check your bill very carefully before you pay!!!  UPDATE: They sent a copy of the bill (same invoice number but for a different amount) to my credit card company that doesn't match the bill that I was given at their office! IT IS FRAUDULENT TO CREATE A RECEIPT FOR PAYMENT THAT DOESN'T MATCH THE RECEIPT FOR PAYMENT THAT I RECEIVED AT THE TIME OF SERVICE!!!

name: Esther Lee
text:
I just came home from Dr. Bedsole's office and truly impressed with their service and assistance.
I broke the one of the temples of my sun glasses ordered via Walmart.  However, they could not fix it because of the "age" of the frame.  I have been in several vision centers but no one could fix it with the same reason.  Finally, Walmart people suggested me to visit Dr. Bedsole's office.  I used to have Dr. Bedsole who did an excellent job for my bi-focal glasses. Yet, I had to change doctor due to my insurance policy.

Although the office was busy with constant walking-in patients, the receptionist was nice and found another lady to take a look of my glasses but no guarantee. It took quit a while for them to get it fixed. I really appreciate their professionalism even though I did not purchase the glasses from them and not even a patient of Dr. Bedsole.  Their service and care for people are not depend on the benefits from a patient. What a good moral standard and role model for other eye doctors!!  Thank you, thank you!!

name: Jackie Jackie
text: Normally I do not take the time write reviews..but the experience was terrible. I had made an appointment and had called to reschedule a couple days later. The lady who answered the phone was very rude and even when I had originally called she was also rude. She was starting to arguing with me that I didn’t even have an appointment?! It is really unfortunate that a business has someone rude like that answering the phones as that would be the first encounter people have with the business. I hoped this place would’ve been great, but their receptionist definitely made sure that was not the case. Canceled appointment with them and will most definitely be looking elsewhere!!

name: Lisa Kline
text:
Absolutely loved how quick the 3 receptionist sign you in and get you back for the visit to begin. Alexis was a very pleasant young lady. Quick, worked efficiently with no supervision. Dr Dunson was an absolute treat to meet. He goes through the process of explaining and even teaching you about your eyes.
The only only complaint I would have is the amount of frames to select from. I've never seen so few brands and selections to look at. This older lady was very very helpful and answered my questions. I will be back for another check up next year with Dr Dunson. I may have to shop frames around town if their selection isn't any better.

name: Linda Olar
text: All staff at the Fairhope office are wonderful. Very friendly and professional.   They get you back quickly and I never have had a long wait.  Dr. Wilder is very nice and professional, but with a great sense of humor.  He is very thorough and I feel very comfortable that my eyes are in very good hands!

name: mj Rooks
text: Needed a new opthamologist and was nervous about going to someone new but Dr. McDaniel was very thorough and put my mind at ease.  His office staff were all gracious and professional.  I feel comfortable to call him my eye doc and will look forward to eye exams in the future.

name: dawnmarie johnson
text: Dr . McDaniels and his staff are the most friendly people you could ever meet. They go out of their way to make you feel comfortable . Dr McDaniels did a fantastic  job on both of my eyes. He answered all my questions. They make you great about everything.

name: RG P
text: The doctor and all his staff were wonderful!  I know during this difficult Pandemic time that we all need to be extra careful, but while practicing new safety measures, some doctors now treat their patients as though they’re radioactive! I’m thankful to say that no one at Southern Eye Group gave me that impression at all. Thank you so much for treating me as a potential friend instead of  a threat.

resp.text: Thank you for this good review!

text: Everyone was very friendly. My appointment was right on time and everyone was very efficient.  There was no push to buy new glasses. I was in and out in a timely manner.

text: After nearly a year worrying about my eyes, Dr McDaniels was able to tell me exactly what was going on. When I left the office I was so relieved. Thank you and the staff for taking care of me and giving me peace of mind.

name: Courtney Mosley
text: This was one of the worst experiences I’ve had in an office in quite some time. The restroom was disgusting. I waited for 3 hours. They did keep apologizing about the wait. They seemed very over staffed. The staff (3-4 of them) was sitting around in the back laughing and talking the entire time. I thought wow, must be nice to have a job like that! I was there for 3 hours and watched nearly half of their day. However, the doctor was great and very informative. When, I checked out I didn’t get my prescriptions (even after I asked for them)and I had to come back again! I called 3 times and no answer. It’s sad the staff wasn’t productive.

name: keith cruitt
text: I felt like Dr. Paul McDaniel was obviously a professional when I saw him July 17, 2020. He understood the complicated issues extending from the glaucoma from which I suffer, and he demonstrated a good personality, including the emotional stabilty that complements his medical competence. I rated him five stars.

resp.text: Thank you for this positive review! We value our patient's feedback and are glad you had a good experience with Dr. Paul McDaniel.

Things like you must wear a mask and all employees would be wearing masks, and that your temperature would be taken. All of us coming in did wear masks. The dr that examined me wore a mask. The temperature was never taken and the people at the desks either had no masks or had them on but not worn properly. (Under their chin). So all that is more than a little irritating.

text: Oh my goodness! I am 💯% pleased with Dr McDaniel and Southern Eye Group and their surgery center. I'm 69 years young and have never seen this good without glasses. I had a bad cateract  covered lense that wes replaced and the 2nd day vision was 20/30. He said it would be even better by 3rd day, I haven't been tested today (it's the 3rd day) but I can read a card across the room, no Lasix was done to correct.   vision but replacing the cateract covered  lense did the job. I am patiently waiting on thw 2nd eye to be done. Thank you Dr McDaniel and staff, I'm a very satisfied patient ❤

name: Rose Strotman
text: Dr Kidd & her team members are all simply amazing. I was trying contacts again after many yrs of not wearing them. She tried out the new bifocal contacts on me. The first brand didn't work for me. She stayed on it until she found the perfectly amazing ones for me. She herself called me to discuss what was going on with the first set. So she would know what corrections she needed to make. My vision is so good in them I am shocked. Every interaction with staff from making the appt to the eye exam and testing the health of my eyes was SUPERIOR. The only challange was that Dr Kidd is yet another example of an extremely beautiful and highly intelligent SOUTHERN woman. She looks about 20 until she opens her mouth. Then you are blown away by her medical intelligence that reminds you she is a highly trained Doctor. I am so thankful I found them. And switched from another local eye glass facility.

name: Laurie Hill
text:
The eye exam itself was great, and the optometrist I saw was professional and thorough. As was the case with last year’s visit to Target Optical, the exam part is the only reason I could give the three stars. My experience LAST YEAR in getting my glasses was a total disaster from start to finish. From being given the wrong glasses which I took home and had to return, to then getting glasses that were marked completely wrong and had the reader part of my bifocals as 75% of my lenses, and beyond.....It was completely subpar in every way. This year I came in knowing that I would not be getting new frames, but may need to get new lenses. I had pre-priced everything on our EyeMed insurance site, and knew within $10-$15 what I would (SHOULD) be paying. Upon talking to the person who tried to help me, I was given an estimate which was over $100 what my insurance told me I am supposed to pay. We went round and round, and ultimately I left without even ordering my lenses. I was also told that even though I wasn’t getting frames, they now have a $25 frame fee to just get lenses.(WHA???) When I got home, my husband and I put in all the information on the eyemed website and again came out with a cost which was over $100 less than what she had quoted me in the store. This experience reminded me that last year, I also had this problem, with upgrades and extras to my prescription being the “default”, and me having to beg for things to be taken off in order for me to get to the simple figure that my insurance would pay. WHY would they not start with the most simple lenses and frames and then give me the price to upgrade and add on extras? Why would they immediately start out with the most expensive features my insurance won’t pay for, and force me to navigate removing the features to get what I want? Particularly since from the get-go I said I wanted the basic package for my glasses (plastic, not poly, etc) and was very clear about the cost that I was expecting? I guess I’m old-fashioned, but I still consider an eye exam to be “healthcare”. I’m not looking for a used car salesman in a person who helps me with my healthcare. That is exactly how I would describe the experience with target optical, and how I would describe the experience I had last year as well. The ladies who helped me were very nice, but I could say the same about all the folks who have ever tried to sell me a car. Want to win my 5 stars, Target? Talk with me about what my budget is. Talk with me about my insurance. Start from the ground up in building my package with my eyeglasses. Be honest with me about what is necessary, and what I can live without. I have always had plastic lenses, and because I am an adult who takes care of my glasses, I never have had so much as a scratch. Don’t try to sell me polycarbonate when I tell you that it’s not something I need! I hope you are getting my message here. I don’t leave feedback lightly, and because you are a partner with our insurance we would like to continue to use your store. I’ve given you two chances, and I’m going to go back one more time to try to get lenses for my eyeglasses AT THE COST I EXPECT even though you are charging me an outrageous $25 fee for frames that I am not actually purchasing. You have two strikes. Hopefully you won’t let me down when I go back.
-Laurie Hill

She was informative, listened to me when I spoke, answered my questions, and quickly performed an in-depth exam and consultation. I cannot praise her enough. I highly recommend you give her practice a try. You won't go back to anyone else for your optometry needs.

name: Laura Galyean
text:
The doctor was behind schedule by 30 minutes. My appointment was at 10am but I wasn’t seen until after 10:30am. My children’s appointments were 11 and 11:30am so it was obvious that we were not going to be on time for theirs. We ended up spending 3 hours there. The other employees were non helpful. The one that helped us was frazzled by everything ( she seemed out of it) and acted like she was completely unfamiliar with the computer system, even though she told me several times she has been doing this for years. She couldn’t locate my sons information nor input anything correctly. The other associate acted as if she was bothered by this employee asking questions and finally said, “ if you need to go home, just go home. I can do this on my own.” She then informed the one helping us “to put the info in this way, I’ve been doing for years and it works.”
This was absolutely the worst experience I have ever had at this location. We have been here at the Carl T. jones location for years (through 3 eye doctors) and have never had to deal with anything this bad.
My hope is that my sons glasses  got ordered correctly & come in correct but I’m not actually sure they will.

One person did not even seem to want to help the other when she was having problems trying to apply my insurance.  At one point I saw her using or playing on a iPad while hiding behind the store laptop computer.  Doctor was competent before I feel she could have done more in the testing part of my vision. Frame choice was not as big as it had been in the past.  Really didn't feel like I had very many choices. My advice is that whoever is in charge of this satellite store needs to really look at what is going on with their workers and do more in depth training and really work on their customer service and attitude towards customers.  The main result of this visit and problem in past visits especially with customer service will have me seeking a new eye doctor next year.

name: R D
text:
I have faithfully had an eye check up annually for many years and in no instance have I ever had a more enjoyable Dr. visit. I have been traveling and not in my home state and I needed to get my exam before the end of the year so as to use my insurance allotment for 2020. My first interaction was over the phone to make an appointment. After telling them my situation they were able to fit me in even though there were no other openings until the next Monday which was not possible for me. Next was my meeting with the front desk assistant Kelsey. She was awesome. She was very patient and helpfull in getting all the proper paper worked and doing the preliminary testing before seeing Dr, Nguyen.She was very knowledgeable and took the  time to explain procedures and answer all my questions and all with a smile.
After this I met with Dr. Nguyen and she too was a pleasure to meet with . She was very professional  and answered my concerns. I never felt I was being rushed out of her office. She also made suggestions for me for better eye care. Thank you all.

resp.text: Thank you for your review. Our associates are some of the best around and we are always happy to hear our customers feel the same!

name: Lucy Reed
text: I received excellent personalized service from Dr. Nguyen and Bill. I was impressed! The eye exam was more thorough than I have received from any ophthalmologist. Dr. Nguyen took her time to review the results of  my testing in detail in 3D, over her computer screen, something I have never seen before. Bill advised me to the type of frame best suited to my prescription and repaired my old frames. I highly recommend LensCrafters  in Foley, Alabama.

resp.text: Hello Lucy, thank you so much for sharing your experience. At LensCrafters our goal is to set the standard in quality in eye care and eyewear by ensuring every patient and customer has the best experience in every location every time. We are very excited to hear about your experience and value your feedback.

That’s what I get for telling the truth.. should of just lied huh! 🙄🙄🙄 They said they required a negative test before I can be seen which makes no sense cause you can’t get a negative test for 90 days after covid.. smh.

text:
I'm so disappointed with the service. My family and I have been ordering glasses through Lenscrafters for quite sometimes and never had an issue. But, this time for some reason, they can't get my prescription right. Not to mentioned the several trips back and forth to the store I've made. Within the last few weeks I have ordered 2 pair of glasses. The 1st pair that I ordered was a complete mess, couldn't see anything. My measurements were totally off. Took a chance on ordering another pair and found out that they didn't fill my prescription correctly so therefore I still couldn't see. The guy was very rude. Bluntly accused me of the mistake and not once did he
apologize.  After that he quoted me a ridiculous price to correct their mistake. I was very disappointed so I asked for a refund and left the store.

text:
My husband and 7 year old daughter both had eye exams this morning with Dr. Potts. I was so very impressed  with the excellent care and customer service we received. He was very thorough, but still efficient and took time to educate us on each test as he went along. This was our daughter’s first eye exam and she was a bit nervous, but Dr. Potts took time to ask specifically what she was nervous about and addressed that with her, putting her at ease right away. When we left she said “that was actually fun!” :) I would highly recommend Dr. Potts for both adults and children!

The staff at Lens Crafters was very kind and welcoming as well. I also love the ability to schedule   exams online! I can’t speak to assistance from the Lens Crafters staff beyond being welcomed today because fortunately no one needed glasses today, but I’ve had great experience personally in the past. Damon was very knowledgeable and helped me to choose frames that were stylish and comfortable for me last year!

Im in the medical field so I know that there is a disconnect within the scheduling system or the greed of bringing in too many patients on any given day... UNBELIEVABLE 😡😡😡

name: derica busby
text: My mother was treated so horrible hear. she had an appt on 12/29/20 @1430 arrived 1420. it was an issue with her VSP insurance, some type of mishap. The two clerks that tried to assist her were pleasant. they gave her an sticky note with number to call to get information corrected, while she was on phone with insurance carrier clerk one came and stated that they give you 30 minutes grace period. it's 1435 at this point. finally she got insurance situated and stepped back up to window and stated she would just be self pay. clerk one and two present along with another medical staff who precedes to call Dr Jackson   and inform that patient would be paying out of pocket, mind you it's 1440 still within time frame. medical staff precedes to hang up phone and say well Dr Jackson said you'll just have to reschedule your appt.my mother was so embarrassed and hurt her being an Registered Nurse could phantom the thought of an medical doctor being to rude and unapologetic. needless to say we will never visit this medical facility again.

text:
I do not trust the techs in the eyeglass store in the same building which is related to the clinic.
Be extremely careful for defects in the exhibited one's. Even when you have asked for a new one, be sure to examine it again when your receive it, ignore it if the techs seemed to be smiling or laughing from your checking. It's a lot of money you pay and you think you will have a good quality!

text:
WAIT WAIT and WAIT
I had to wait total of two hours before they could see me!!!
I will give it -1. Can’t give them any start at all. This is for the non medical staff.

text: Waited a full hour to be seen. Horrible scheduling. This is not our first or second visit where we have had to wait but I assure you it is our last. Tried to give them the benefit of the doubt but no more. My time is just as valuable as theirs.

name: D Williams
text: A recent eye exam with Dr. Jackson literally brightened my world!  Thanks to his expert evaluation and treatment, my vision is back in focus for  daily visual tasks I used to take for granted.  Do your eyes a favor by letting Dr. Jackson help them do their job.  Highly recommend!

text: I had and appointment with Dr. Douglas for my continuing eye treatment while my regular doctor was away from the clinic. I appreciated his gentle treatment and taking the time to answer all our guestions.

text: I loved Dr. Ron Swain Jr and all of the staff at Premier Medical! My son had his tonsils and adenoids removed and within 6 hours of leaving the facility there was someone from the office calling to check in on him.

text: A pleasant experience from beginning to end. The office employees are very courteous and this location has top tier doctors . The wait time is short compared to other physician offices that I've visited.

text: Some employees are very helpful. But the manager of the contact station is unprofessional and was helpful in no way.

name: Heather Richardson
text: I went in there because for month I had been suffering from an eye pain that I just woke up one day with . Finally went to go check it out waited in my room for a good bit of time before asking how much longer he was going to be . He came in shortly after barely even looked at me said it was allergies , I said I've never had allergies in my life . His reply welcoming to getting older (I'm 28) so after taking his word even though he was a jerk I did the eye drops he gave me ect . The eye pain finally got so unbearable I went to another doctor I knew it couldn't be allergies . Turns out it was an ulcer on my cornea and blisters on my eyelids , which dr Jackson would have seen if he actually took the time. He could have cost me my eye sight and will always be recommended to avoid in my book!!!!

With something like glasses that you have to wear everyday they shouldn't make you feel like a burden or waste of their time.

name: Esme' Waters
text: Rude, rude, rude! I completely agree with the review of Marcus Williams. Dr. Scott is the most arrogant man I have ever encountered. What is wrong with Optical places around here?

name: Shelby Bishop
text:
My husband had to get his glasses remade three times, and each time they were rude. No one could tell us how long a replacement would take and seemed bothered when we asked for updates.

Waiting in the lobby, I overheard the mom next to me say she was here for their glasses to be remade because they weren’t right. Staff seemed to treat her just as they did us.

name: Marcus Williams (TheSevereWay)
text: Dr. Scott is rude and arrogant. The one doctor I liked is no longer there. The office always has an excuse for their continued poor service. I gave them ample chances, in hopes that they could prove to be (at the least) satisfactory.

name: Lorrie Pate
text: This place is amazing! Im partial to dr.mcgowen. but the entire staff is so helpful. Over the last 2 years they have fit us in and regular appointments were so easy!!! Got our glasses in 1 hour! Great service! Great selections and merchandise! If u have ever had a preteen during covid needing eye glasses, its complicated, but cherise was wonderful!!!

name: Madelyn Wiggins
text: I had a very good experience buying my first pair of glasses from here. I brought in a prescription from another optometrist and selected my frames, and my glasses were ready within an hour after ordering. I was especially surprised given that I had two different prescriptions for my eyes, one of which had astigmatism correction. The price for the lenses was also very fair compared to the variety of other places I looked at. The women who helped me were very kind, and helped me by making the process very quick and easy.

name: Chris Devall
text: Very rude! Just called their office to see where my wife’s referral information is from a doctors office they referred me to and was mistreated  and hung up on in my face by their  receptionist because I guess the fax machine was to far away to send the information that was already supposed to be sent. My wife’s is going blind already and that’s just what she needs from another person is that attitude! Thanks Baldwin eye clinic! I wonder if they even care about people eye problems or are they just interested in making money off peoples eye problems and being rude in the process? Thanks Baldwin eye clinic!

name: Shelly Pickle
text: I love Dr. Scott!!!! The ladies are very helpful, great at assisting in finding the perfect pair of glasses for your face and take their time making the adjustments to be certain you have the right fit. I stop in on occasion to have them cleaned at no charge, the ladies are really sweet and it only takes a minute. They also went the extra mile in helping me find contacts that work for me. Which wasn't an easy task. I won't go anywhere else.

name: EggoTheMeggo
text:
Great for people who only need a slight correction since they can get their glasses same day, but if you have astigmatism, don't bother getting your glasses here. Walmart gets them faster. It's been a week since I ordered mine and they still haven't given me an estimate for how much longer it will be for my glasses to be ready. Prices are also so much higher than other options in the area. They also charge for adjustments whereas Walmart is free. Definitely room for improvement.

Edit: I received a phone call from Bay Minette Optical telling me my glasses were sent to their office instead of the Daphne location. This is Friday. Then they proceeded to tell me that they can mail them over to the Daphne location and I MIGHT have them by Saturday. No thanks, I'll just come get them today so I can make sure nothing else happens to them.

name: Warren Wood
text: The staff and doctors at the Baldwin Eye Clinic are all very friendly and helpful. I really like Dr. Scott and his no nonsense approach to solutions to any problems I had with my eyes and vision. He was straight forward with me and resolved my dry eye condition when no other eye doctors would even offer a solution other than eye drops. I would and will recommend the clinic to others.

name: Mike Smith
text: SLOW and unorganized! You will wait at least 2 hours every time. No one ever knows what is going on. Tons of staff just sitting around while customers wait. They need all new receptionist. The ones they have are rude and and are not professional.

name: Doug Snow
text: Great experience, wonderful Doctor and staff, highly recommend

name: Melissa Engelke
text: I've been using this place for a few years. The doctors are great. Prices are a bit much, but so is everything else these days. The only downside I always have is needing to wait 5 - 10 days to get my glasses back. I do not know if this is just because my prescription is a PIA or what. Overall, I do recommend them.

name: Paul Gridler
text: It is always a pleasure to go to Baldwin Eye Clinic. From the time I checked in, took the exam and checked out, everyone made me feel very comfortable. Dr.Adcock also took time to explain what he found and what he recommended.They don't try and sell you something if you don't need it or you don't like it. I highly recommend them!!

name: Carol Anne Stark
text: I have been using Baldwin Eye Clinic for several years and have been very pleased with  the optometrists. I have gotten my appointments quickly and have not had to wait long once I arrived for my appointment. Any problems I have had with my eyes have been taken care of and I love my current glasses that I got there. I highly recommend this clinic.

name: Stephen Bertagnolli
text: Great people, great doctors, quick appointments, superb service. I like how the doctor took time with me to explain things as he went to make sure I understood. It's the little things like that that matter.

name: Dana Pridgen
text: Dr Adcock was great but the prices are not competitive to say the least. There are extra charges and exam costs are overpriced. The woman at the front desk was extremely rude and condescending. I can't believe I actually paid money to be treated like that!! I would only go to Baldwin Eye Clinic if you want to pay too much and be treated poorly.

name: Christopher Irizarry
text: Over priced for what they did. Also the Person that supposly checked me was not listening at all to what I was saying and felt kinda rude from his part.

name: Lauri Breaud
text: Baldwin Eye Clinic went over and beyond my expectations. I found them on the internet and was excited to schedule because not only could I fill out my paperwork online before my arrival, they were open on Friday afternoons (when I'm off of work)! I was literally in and out of there within 30 minutes, and that included a screening, eye exam, vision exam, and choosing out my glasses. Dr. Cobb was great-- she not only told me about my vision, but also about quirky things about my eye anatomy. She seems like she truly loves what she does-- which is something I can relate to and appreciate. The fact that I went pick up my glasses an hour after picking them out was AWESOME as well as the fact that my contacts were in STOCK at the office. Definitely the best eye clinic I've ever been to. I would recomment them & Dr. Cobb to anyone and everyone!

name: Dan Therrell
text: I was referred to Baldwin Eye Clinic by a friend, and I had an eye exam and checkup there recently. I am very satisfied with the promptness, courtesy, and professionalism of the entire office staff. The advice I requested from Dr. Adcock about laser eye surgery helped me understand all my future options and helped me make a decision that I had been concerned about for some time. I recommend Bay Eye Clinic to anyone who needs eye care.

name: Linda Ball
text: I love Baldwin eye clinic! The Dr's and staff are friendly and do a through job! I have never had to go back with wrong eye prescription and you usually get your glasses sooner than they say!

name: Taylor Waite
text: Absolutely the best in Baldwin County. We trust Doctor Bernard Scott & Doctor Joe Adcock for our eye exams, contact lenses & eye glasses. Doctor Scott & Doctor Adcock are some of the most experienced eye doctors in the County & they are on the cutting edge with current technologies involving eye care.

name: NATALIE DUPONT
text: Efficient and friendly staff!  THe new eye doctor was great!  Will recommend to everyone!

name: Ginger Chaudron
text: After not seeing Dr. Adcock for several years, I am happy to be a patient again.  I was very pleased with my checkup and plan to be a regular again.  Thank you, Baldwin Eye Clinic and Dr. Adcock!

name: Joy Turner
text: This is a very good eye clinic.  It is convenient to me, always have what I need, and they do thorough eye exams.

name: Jordan Barron
text: Everyone was very friendly. I called beginning of week and was able to get in that same week and leave with my new glasses on the same day! I would definitley recommend Baldwin Eye Clinic!! :)

name: A Holley
text: I have been seeing Doctor Adcock for 4+ years now, and he never fails to make my visit as comfortable as possible. His humor and decorum are unsurpassed .  **good thing he is NEVER retiring!!

name: SAH Daddy
text:
Great staff, great docs, great experience!

Ordered a set of glasses with lenses that had Anti-Reflectors, but decided not to get the lightweight due to insurance issues. Told me the glasses would take 2 weeks to come in. Got a call the next day saying they are ready...and found out they were giving me the lightweight addition for free!

I've been going to this place for a few years, and they don't normally dish out freebies to me...but it was nice of them to do that for a semi-longterm customer! (I always tend to scratch/break my glasses beyond repair before insurance will help pay for them...turning 25 and still am a clutz like a 12 year old).

Also love how the doctor I had(horrible memory sorry!) went into detail about my eyes in layman terms. Just an overall great experience.

name: Kristi Riales
text: I love Baldwin Eye Clinic One Hour. Dr. Adcock is an amazing doctor and took his time and explained everything to me. He is exceptional at his job.

name: Christopher Pancner
text: The optometrist is great! As are the optical wear specialists! However I am dissatisfied with the receptionists, they were not very friendly.

name: Carol Timmons
text: my resent visit to Baldwin Eye Clinic was awesome ,the staff was very friendly and informative .Regina makes me feel at home and Karen always gets me the perfect appt.    Dr. Adcock is the best.

text: I am very pleased with Dr. Dunagan and her technician. Dr. Dunagan is always very concerned with my eye care and getting my vision corrected as best she can. I enjoy the service I receive and drive all the way from Gulf Shores to receive my eye care at BEC. Thank you.

text: The staff and doctor were not only polite, but knowledgeable. Immediately after I signed in, I was brought back to the exam room to wait for the doctor. Dr. Everett arrived in under a minute and immediately got to work. This was the best, most efficient eye exam I've ever went through - and as someone with astigmatism, I've had plenty of eye exams. I can not recommend this optometrist enough.

resp.text: Thank You!!

text: I have been a patient for years and am more than satisfied with Dr. Marshall. In fact, he cares for our entire family of four. Also, staff is friendly, well-informed and thoroughly professional. Highly recommended!

Doesn't use big terminology, just everyday language.  Always prompt and you never have to wait - an appointment is exactly what it says - an appointment.

text: My children and I have been seeing Dr. Marshall for years and absolutely love him and his staff! He is quick, great with children, happy to answer any questions, and very friendly. Anytime someone asks for a good optometrist, I recommend Downtown Eyecare!

name: Thomas Kaufmann
text: Excellent eye care by Dr. Everett Marshall and Staff! They have the health of my eyes and vision, and my personal well-being at the heart of their practice! I am very pleased to so highly recommend Downtown Eye Care!

They have very nice frames & stylish options to choose from ,they also Sanitize & keep everything clean due to COVID which I really liked .

name: Colleen Fegan
text: I had a sudden Flash and floater, called Dr Marshall around and 6 p.m. Tuesday night at his emergency number, he called me right back. Worked me in the next day to check and make sure everything was okay, totally confident that he is taking care of my eye health!

No answer by that's just what he said. I would have to get a 3 month supply.  Politely, will switch my eyecare doctor with swiftness.

text: THE VERY BEST!

name: Rachel Adams
text: Annual eye exam in and out in 30 minutes, cannot beat it! Fantastic customer service from time of booking, to recommendations on contact lenses and glasses, to check-out. Could not recommend Downtown Eye Care, Dr. Marshall, and his staff highly enough. Run, don't walk if you're in need of an optometrist in Montgomery!

resp.text: Thank you Rachel!!

name: Brittney Morales
text:
Dr. Marshall is honestly one of the best doctors I've ever seen. His bedside manners are impeccable. He walks you through the whole exam and converses throughout as to make it a comfortable environment. He was thorough and personable. I just wish more doctors were like this!

Very clean and great location.

resp.text: Thank you for the review Brittney!

name: KAYLYNN WADE
text: Absolutely Wonderful

name: Courtney Aycock
text: Dr. Marshall and his staff are great!  Really friendly and helpful. I really appreciate being given different samples of contact lenses to try before I buy. Would definitely recommend Downtown Eye Care!

resp.text: Thank you for the review Courtney! We appreciate your feedback!

name: Whitney Miller-Nichols
text: Love Dr. Marshall and all the staff at Downtown Eye Care! They are always ready to see my right when I get there and have been so helpful when picking out glasses. I would definitely recommend that you visit them!

name: LaVon Fuller
text:
I've recently moved to Montgomery so I'm starting from scratch with eye doctors, dentist, etc. I initially booked an appointment with Downtown Eye Care simply because it was the nearest one to my home. My first experience was pleasant and Dr. Marshall is very sweet and personable and its apparent he's somewhat new in the practice (opening in 2013. However, the receptionist leaves something to be desired. She's very dry and rude! Maybe it's just me but I expect good customer service from the time I walk in the door until I walk out, ESPECIALLY if I'm paying for a service.
My second visit was booked for the wrong time and I sat in the lobby for an hour just to tell them my contacts fit. And once again she was rude! Anywho, Dr. Marshall, and the lady that fits your glasses were sweet. I'm contemplating going back.

name: D D
text: Great visit. Very efficient.

name: Daniel Casher
text: I like Dr Sealock...very nice man. Great service from the whole staff. Ms Pam is very sweet.

resp.text: Thank you Daniel.  It was a pleasure meeting you.

name: Shirley Smith
text: They take very good care of my eyes.

resp.text: thank you very much it was our pleasure to serve you

name: Matthew C
text: I've been coming here for about 17 years. If you want someone who knows what he's doing, is extremely good at his job, and highly recommended then come here. I couldn't express how good Dr. Sealock is!

name: Joann Bradley

name: bulldog44sos
text:
Details05/05/2017
Went there for an eye exam last year. I purchased some REALLY nice glasses and contacts. Blew about $450 in there. After my exam and purchase, I asked for my eye test results and PD (pupilairy distance) because my employer requires safety glasses and they will not allow me to wear my daily glasses with side shields. Also, since my employer is so strict on the glasses, they provide me with a free pair every year, but my prescription has to be up to date. The ladies behind the desk refused to give me my exam results because it was against their policy. Basically they didn't want me to take my prescription to a competitor and purchase glasses or contacts. I explained my situation and that I had just spent almost 500 on glasses and contacts (and thats additional to insurance paying 150 toward my frames) with them. Didn't matter. I walked to the back and grabbed the optometrist. He gave me my prescription so I could take it to work. That's like a doctor giving you a physical and not giving you your test results because he's afraid you'll use another pharmacy besides the one in his office! That's CRAZY! THOSE ARE MY MEDICAL RECORDS! I'll never set foot into Marx in Cullman again!

name: eric hubbard
text:
This place is a joke. Staff was rude on the phone setting up my appointment. Staff was rude as soon as I walked in the door. Staff was rude while telling me the doctor just didn't show up today so the owner was coming to fill in. Staff was rude telling me that I could come back. So I was rude walking out the door telling them a simple phone call would have been nice. Was going to come back at 12:30 anyway but decided that I wasnt going to let these people get a dime**Could have at least asked me to fill out the insurance papers and told me the doctor was running behind, wouldn't have bothered me a bit**
----11/16/18----. Appointment WAS at 11:15
Dear owner, if your profit margin is dropping at all. I'm guessing this is the reason. If not, imagine what it could be if you actually had good reviews.

text: Great visit! They see people even if you have no appointment.. They staff could be a tad more interactive while they assist you, but overall great!

name: Julie Parker
text: Dr. Brian Pyron is a wonderful Optometrist . His friendly attitude and attention insured that l received great care. I would definitely recommend McCalla Eyecare.

name: toby jolly
text:
I can’t wear acuvue oasys contacts due to my eyes reacting to silicone. This is an unbearable condition to the point you can’t sleep at night. I have been treated for this before here and swapped back to acuvue 2 as soon as we figured out what was going on. Last week I used a pair of leftover oasys contacts by mistake and yesterday afternoon my right eye reacted. Last night and this morning were miserable and to make it worse I couldn’t find the drops I was prescribed for the reaction.

This morning I called the eye center and asked if they could call in the drops so my wife could pick them up and bring them to me at work. I got short smartass answers and was told that they couldn’t call in the eye drops I would have to see the doctor that was filling in today. She said if I got there by 2 they would work me in. Fine.

I took off work early and arrived a little before 2. Staff attitude was terrible. My eye was blood red and I was obviously not feeling well. A little after 2 I was told there are 3 people ahead of me and it might be a while and asked if I wanted to wait. I don’t know, how long will it be? She didn’t know. Asked me again if i wanted to wait. Again I said how long? I don’t know she said. Ok, how long does each patient take to be examined? 30-45 minutes she replied. At this point it was after 2, she had already told me the doctor was leaving at 330, and was obviously hinting for me to leave. I told her to remove me from the list i was leaving. She was happy to do so.

So it’s Friday evening, I have a very obvious problem with my right eye, and she is happy to just send me away with no advice on what to do and not even offering to have a quick word with the doctor. Again, this is an easily diagnosed problem, especially with a history of it in my file, and the only thing I need are some non narcotic eye drops from the pharmacy.

I googled eye doctor in the parking lot and saw Cargus eyecare a mile away. When I walked in I asked if they were taking new patients and could fit me in today. The lady at the counter took one look at my eye and said I can’t turn you away with your eye looking like that we will definitely work you in. Within an hour I had seen the doctor and was gone.

I will never be back to mccalla eyecare. The reviews on here regarding poor service are legit. This isn’t the 1st time I have experienced it but it was the last. If anyone from there reads this do not bother calling, no need to apologize, I’m done.

Oh btw. Several months ago I was shopping for some Costa sunglasses. When I figured out mccalla eyecare sells them I stopped by to see if patients get any kind of a discount. I was told no they are required to sell them at retail with no discount. Fine. I was still interested so I took a look at them anyway. I was looking for a specific pair and had looked at them online and at several stores. Long story short mccalla eyecare doesn’t sell costas at suggested retail. They are marked up 10 or 20 percent, I can’t remember which. Doesn’t matter though the point is she lied to me and I just happened to know better. One star isn’t low enough for their customer service.

name: Yvonne Cicero
text: They are so sweet and dr is very helpful have to have a lot of patience my eyes are crazy to deal with love them

name: kyesha smith
text: Avoid. Customer service is awful. Doctors rotate so you never know who you’re dealing. Seriously...go to Walmart vision of you have to go somewhere because they are more helpful believe it or not.

name: Daniel Walker
text: Do not visit this place. After being there for over 2 1/2 hours, the "Doctor" gave me some contacts to wear while mine were being ordered. I knew when I put them in they were wrong, I told him several times this is not the correct prescription, he told me my eyes were blurry from the dilation, it took awhile to get use to them. I said no, these are the wrong contacts. After more waiting while he tried to juggle several patients at once, causing mass confusion for the staff and other waiting patients he finally looked my chart and saw he did give me the wrong contacts. Honest mistake? Sure, we are all human, but the fact it took a dozen attempts to get him to simply check the chart and him trying to reassure me my eyes were just blurry from the dilation, leads me to conclude this optometrist is reckless and unconcerned about patient safety. I have very little confidence in the accuracy or quality of his exam. I wasted my money, my time, and possibly my health, if he neglected to properly exam my eyes, as he neglected to properly examine my chart.

name: M Miller
text: Horrible, horrible, horrible. Had an eye exam and ordered glasses. First pair came in with the wrong prescription.  They redid my eye exam and said they made a mistake so they reordered my glasses. 2 weeks later I hadn’t heard a word so I called. Was put on hold for 20 min. I hung up at 20 min. Called back. Was put on hold for 7 min. Finally told my glasses had been shipped back with demo lenses installed. They apologized and told me when I came in I could select a pair of sunglasses as compensation for my trouble. Another 10 day wait. Glasses come in. I go to get them and ask about the offer of sunglasses. A nasty woman announces loudly from behind a counter that she’s the only person that can approve such an offer and she doesn’t know anything about it.  So I tell her, well, that’s what I was offered on the phone. She tells me she’ll have to investigate it. A little while later they call and tell me that they have “a” pair of sunglasses I can have. No choice allowed. I go to get them and they are a pair that was clearly returned by someone. I ask to speak to the “manager” and all of a sudden she’s unavailable.  These people lie. They are overworked and under supported by the company. I’ll never do business with them again. 36 days to get a pair of glasses is absurd and reneging on their offer is simply amateur.  So sad this is what this business has been reduced to.

name: Jackie Jackson
text: Horrible experience.   This is NOT Schaeffer Eye Clinic! But, they don't tell you that.  I did not get what I asked for and  was told i could not get the custom  lenses I wanted.    Yet, the old pair  of lenses from Schaeffer were exactly what I wanted. Selection of frames, Limited, especially on the high end.  Their service is basic and over priced!

name: Debbie Simmons
text: This was the worst Schaeffer experience I've EVER had. I arrived for my appointment a little early and filled out the paperwork to update my information. I was the only patient in the waiting room. I waited 50 mins before seeing the doctor. They directed another patient in to the room I was already in. On my way out after paying I asked for my prescription and they gave me my old perscription and not all of my personal information had been updated and it was not signed by the doctor - which I did not realize until I was ordering my glasses, elsewhere of course. A very unpleasant experience and waste of time. Very inefficient staff. I would not have given them one star but I could not post unless I did.

name: sara soltani
text: I had a pair of glasses and got a second pair here, but the new prescription wasn't working fine for me so I had to go back to change the lenses. Everyone was nice during first visit, but when I returned, Dr. Benjamin was behaving very badly that I got stressed out. I even asked her about it, but she didn't seem to care and called me confused and said  I don't know what I want! (Of course, that's why we need help of a doctor!) I don't know if she had other problems or what but that's not a good excuse to treat a patient like that!

name: Wade Kwon
text:
For some 15 years, I've been visiting Schaeffer Eye Center under the care of Dr. Patricia Benjamin. She has been terrific: friendly, attentive and wry in making sure my eyes aren't suffering from the glare of all those screens.

I see more clearly thanks to Schaeffer.

name: Tracy Jackson
text: The staff here are very attentive and kind! Always willing to help

name: CAROL SKELTON
text: Not the same service as I was used o with Schaeffer Eye Center, been waiting on the correct glasses since June 14, 2019 and  I am being told this morning (7-25-2019) they expect  them to be in by August 1, 2019.  Very strange.

name: Lindsey Cochran
text: Worst experience ever and they don't even care. Told me I couldn't wear contacts (even though I have none to wear anymore) and I needed to wear glasses, except my glasses are broken and I can't see out of them. Bought new glasses told they would be in next week, but when I called they said it would be another week. I also have an eye condition that requires eye drops but they won't approve the insurance to cover them. So now I can't see, have severe migraines because of it and my eyes burn all the time. Every time I call for help and they speak to me as if I am stupid every single time. Don't waste your time here they don't actually help you they just want your money.

name: Miss Lan Pretty
text: Great service

name: Matthew O'Brien
text: Doesn't open on time.

name: Ben C Preston
text:
Dr St. John did a superb job in restoring my vision from blurry double-vision to excellent clear 20/10. I can read the tiniest letters & numbers now.  He has a very calm, pleasant demeanor, and listens patiently to my concerns & questions. A top notch doctor!
I initially called Vision Partners for an urgent appointment and they worked me in with a courteous response.   The telephone wait time nowadays is common everywhere and if you be patient they will get to you and solve your problem. Excellent service from scheduling to medical treatment. Ben C Preston

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: Esme' Waters
text: I brought my elderly mother in to order her glasses. The two women working were very nice but it was obvious the department was understaffed. They had a line of people waiting and some were getting impatient and even rude. The office was very hot like the air conditioning was broken. I felt sorry for them having to work under those circumstances. My mother is elderly and in poor health. She was very uncomfortable have to wait without any air-conditioning. As busy as this office appears to be I doubt it is having money problems so I highly suggest you adequately staff your office and fix your air conditioning. It just really looks like someone is being stingy and that's not a good look.

resp.text: Thank you for taking time to give feedback.  We will look into the areas of concern that you mentioned.

name: BOSSNOODLE 2262
text:
They made my visit a quick and easy appointment. Once they checked my eyes, they let me pick out the frames that I liked and after a few days they called me in to pick up my glasses. Fantastic customer service through it all.
Edit: my name is Christopher Searcy if you would like to look up my name in the system (mainly for the owner)

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words!!

name: Chelsea Decker
text: Great experience. Dr. Smalls was very patient with me and my husband. She is caring and explains all things very well. The staff was very helpful also. Great crew.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words!

name: Property Care & Maintenance
text:
Nobody to answer the phone,  your always waiting for the next available agent. The billing is part of company totally separate from the doctors and cannot provide any info unless you have a particular Dr. to deal with.
Then .... they cannot give you any information on insurance companies that the billing department will deal with.
I cannot imagine what would happen if you needed to contact some one for something you really needed.
Cannot complain about the people because I never got to talk to anyone other than in billing and they could not help me because I wanted to know about insurance ... which each doctor deals with separately.

resp.text: I apologize for the phone problems.  We had a new system installed and are working out the kinks.  I would like to have our office manager contact you to resolve the issue.  What number can we contact you at?

name: linda phillips
text: Dr Small is awesome! Greeter at the door very nice.. but lady at desk was rude not friendly at all! Sad to say

resp.text: I apologize for your encounter at the front desk.  We’d like to hear more about what happened so we can improve.  Please call our office manager, Venessa, at 650-2020.

name: Madison H
text:
Doctor was 45 minutes late and incompetent. Both experiences were miserable, weird and unprofessional.

Late and unprofessional doctor/ staff, unsanitary and unmonitored Environment, not ran well generally.
Thankfully there are other eye care clinics in Mobile! (I would prefer to walk around constantly squinting and running into things than go to this “clinic” again.I have had several annoying, maybe even BIZARRE experiences here. During my first checkup I had the pleasure of watching a screaming old woman- WITH ONLY ONE SHOE ON-  hobbling after her child (?) with the OTHER SHOE IN HER HAND! If this somehow isn’t unsanitary it is at least alarming....! After dealing with the rude, impatient  ladies at the front desk, a nurse dilated my eyes and told me the doctor “would be right in.” 45 minutes later, My doctor (don’t remember name) casually walks in and performs what could have been an eye exam (?), only to tell me my RX is the same...I was late for my next appt. and was generally annoyed. The second time was through phone call- I just needed my lens RX  and although the lady seemed nice enough, she did not answer the first call and when I called again she told me she would send it through email “immediately, before she left”,one unanswered phone call and a week later I still have not received the email. Guess I will call a third time. Currently looking for another clinic.

resp.text: Would you please tell us why you left a bad review.  We’d like to know what we can do to improve our performance.  You can reach me at twhite@vp2020.com

name: Ron Bryan
text: I'll begin by saying that Dr. White is great and my family is sad to be leaving him. That being said, his office staff is rude and incompetent. Our insurance does not require referals for routine eye exams. The last time my daughter went, they billed it as a specialty eye exam, which does require a referal. Needless to say, insurance denied it and we received a bill. That took several hour on the phone and 5 months to get straightened out. Today, I called to schedule my wife for a routine eye exam and was told she needed a referal. I explained our insurance and was told that was their policy. I asked to speak to the office manager, was put on hold, and the same lady came back and said that she spoke to the office manager and that the office manager said, at this point, I interupted her and once again asked to speak to the office manager. She said sure and transferred me to voicemail. We will not be returning.

resp.text: Mr. Bryan, I am sorry to hear this.  I would try to resolve your issue myself, but I admit that insurance is not my specialty.  I would like to get our office manager involved with this.  What number can I have her call you at?  Again, I apologize for all of this.  Tim White.

name: John G
text: The wrong insurance was billed and after contacting the office twice the problem wasn't corrected after assurances that the mistake was their fault and would be corrected. We finally paid the bill out of pocket since they were threatening collection. Although the doctors are good the office staff will make us take future business elsewhere.

resp.text: I apologize for the frustration.  If you would, please email your info to me at twhite@vp2020.com   I would like to look into the situation for you.

name: Tracy Johnson
text: First visit with Dr. White today. Very nice. The employees were helpful. Good selection and help with eyeglasses. A bit pricey on frames but who isnt.

resp.text: Thank you very much for your kind words!!  We appreciate you coming in.

name: Mary Rifley
text: I really like Dr. White and Dr. Mcgowin.  What I don't like is the difficulty getting through to the appointment desk as another reviewer complained about.  Non stop info about Vision Partners.  If only a real live person would say hello and tell me to hold please, I'd give them 5 stars.

resp.text: I apologize about the appointment line.  We will look into making approvements.  TBW

name: Eli Stephens
text: My 9 yr. old son was in the Mobile location on October 4, 2019.  He had picked out the black on black plastic Ray Ban frames.  The staff stated that it would take 2 weeks for his frames to come in so he had to go without glasses which contributed to him having major headaches.  They stated they would call me once they came in to come and pick them up.  I had to call them 3 separate times and physically go into the office and ask if they had come in yet for me to finally get my son's glasses, only to realize that they were the wrong frames.   He has been wearing the wrong frames for the last 3 weeks b/c he couldn't go a day longer without glasses due to his headaches. The staff there stated they would order the correct frames which should only take a week..... I have called the Mobile office 6 separate times (last call was Friday November 1, 2019)  with the response of, "I don't know what you’re talking about, can you repeat what is going on again?" and with "I don't see any frames for the name of ****** here for pick up"..... with no resolution.  I have drove up there 3 separate times, the last time being yesterday, November 4, 2019, and a member of the staff sat there and pulled my son's frames out of her desk drawer and stated, "well, they're right here"... with attitude and with a disgusted look on her face that clearly showed that she was bothered with having to even deal with the situation.  I then asked how long they have had the correct frames there because I NEVER received a phone call to advise me that they were there for pick up.  Their response was, " I don't know"...... They stated they needed the glasses off my son's face before they would give me the correct glasses for him to wear and attempted to take them off his face right there.  I told them they were not taking the glasses off of my son's face and we are leaving with his new glasses that we had paid for. They then stated i would have to call management to try to resolve the issue and they just sat there without giving me the name and number of the person I needed to talk to.  I had to ask them for that information directly.   Needless to say, I left the office yesterday, yet again, empty handed because they never gave me the glasses that we originally ordered and paid for.  I WILL NEVER GO BACK TO VISION PARTNERS AGAIN!!!!  The staff is the most unfriendly, difficult, incompetent, and rude group of people I have had to deal with.

resp.text:
I apologize for this situation!!  If you would, please email me your contact info and I will see what I can do.
Twhite@vp2020.com
Tim White

name: Brian Gay
text:
The eye exam experience should not be that difficult, but somehow they make it that way.

I have had the worst experience with all of the Vision Partner branches, but the one on Stanton Rd. took the cake. The staff was unbelievably rude and poorly trained. I went up to talk to the receptionist, she shooshed me, asked me if I didn't see her talking on the phone, and then closed the glass. I had an appointment at 9:30, but didn't get in until 11:00. When I did make it back to the office, they told me we would have to wait an hour and a half for my son's eyes to dilate. If this was the case, then why didn't they do that while we were already waiting. All in all, they expected me to be there for over 3 hours for an exam that might take 10 minutes.

The Daphne branch and Providence branches are just as bad. In Daphne, the doctors told me my eyes are getting better and I needed a weaker prescription. I asked them how was that possible since I have had glasses for 30 years and they stay pretty much the same or get maybe slightly worse. I thought that was just common sense, but I thought I could trust them. When I got my glasses back, they made my eyes cross. The staff told me that was because I needed a few days to adjust to the new prescription. After a few days, nothing. I took them back, got a new pair and the same thing happened again. It took them 3 tries before they could correct the problem.

Like I said, I have been wearing glasses for over 30 years, lived all around the US, and have never had a problem. Optometry is usually pretty simple, but for some reason these people make it really hard. My advice it to go somewhere else because anywhere would be better than these guys.

name: Michael Linder
text: Dr. McGowin is one of the most competent, thorough, and kind physicians I have ever seen. Her manner puts you at ease and she has a true healers touch.

Arab. Alabama.

name: Brenda Clark
text: Dr. Baxter and the whole staff were nice and answered all my questions. I would recommend them to anyone.

name: Tammy Pruitt
text:
Absolutely love Dr.  Vandiver. Which he sent me to Dr. Mitchell @ Maynor and Mitchell Eye Center.  Dr. Mitchell removed my cataracts in both eyes.  He is very professional with great ethics, my surgery was done and in appx 2 hours, and he sends you to lunch, then returned back at his office at 12:00(**that was my time, it may be different for other patients **) .  He likes to Ck and see the eye to make sure surgery went good and no complications.  I have been in glasses since I was 10 years old, with the cataracts removed from both eyes I am now seeing 20/10 and 20/15 in my eyes! I was so much the colors of things were so different, so vibrant and pretty.I no longer did not have halos, I realized they were only one thing I  was looking at, which was a good thing. I did not know what to think it took a minute for my brain to comprehend that I no longer needed glasses to see distance.
I will always have to wear glasses to read, but I am amazed at the quality of work and how How easy it was to have the surgery to see just how things look, how clear I could see things, without having to wear contacts or glasses not to mention developing and having cataracts.. I was told by my regular doctor;  Dr.  Vandiver in Athens, Having cataract surgery is almost 100% correction; where optional Lasix surgery to correct far vision is only temporary and Then you have to wear glasses or contacts or are to have Lasix to be re-done , usually in 10-20 years.  I was never able to afford having the Lasix surgery (because it is considered a cosmetic surgery) so I wore contacts and glasses all my life!  When I developed cataracts I did not understand why I could not see In my correction glasses/ contacts that I was used to wearing.  When Dr. Mitchell done my surgery, let me REMIND you it was in and out, within four hours I was seeing (almost ) perfect, I had very minimal swelling and the next day at my check up (Dr. Vandiver) My swelling was almost completely down, which even amazed my regular eye doctor. Dr. Vandiver , even helped me out with some really expensive eye drops by giving me a couple of samples( with my RX INSURANCE COST ME $70.00 out of pocket.) I found Dr. Mitchell to be very professional, caring, and very informative.  He is not one of the doctors that just does the work and then rushes you out of his office. He took his time, he done the job, and he made sure my eyes were healthy before he discharged me.  Dr.  Mitchell did NOT PROMISE ME THAT I WOULD BE ABLE TO GET TO A PERFECT EYE SIGHT……however, even though he did not promise he did tell me that he would do his best for me to see clearly, Now I can perfect better than perfect (in MY OPINION) I could not be any help happier!  I Highly, highly recommend
Dr. Mitchell’s service. He will take care of you no matter what your circumstances are!!
THANKS TO DR. MITCHELL NO MORE EXPENSIVE PROGRESSIVE LENSES OR EXPENSIVE CONTACTS, even if he did not promise that, he done a great job with the surgery, and my eyes are brighter, and healthier!…. I would do it all again 100 times over. Thank you Dr. Mitchell and  to your team!.

Mrs. Pruitt

name: Theresa Colbert
